results.description:
About | Past Presentations | Biophilia: Pittsburgh Directory

Biophilia: Pittsburgh is the pilot chapter for a global Biophilia Network of creative minds dedicated to strengthening the bond between people and the natural world through education, discussion and action. 

Our Goals

• To welcome and inspire others with the concept and principles of biophilia
• To foster collaboration and learning between professionals from a wide variety of disciplines
• To communicate biophilic principles in action-oriented ways to a wider audience for exponential and regional impact

What Is Biophilia?

The term “biophilia,” which literally means “love of life,” was coined by social psychologist Erich Fromm and popularized by biologist E.O. Wilson, who defined it as “the innately emotional affiliation of human beings to other living organisms.” 

The implications of biophilia extend across a vast array of disciplines including design and engineering, nutrition, psychology, public health, education, biology and the humanities. Biophilia is expressed all over the world every day, through complex collaborations such as the design and construction of buildings and landscapes; and intimate, personal encounters including nature hikes and home gardening.

What Will We Do?

It all starts with good conversation! Biophilia: Pittsburgh will begin by meeting monthly at the Center for Sustainable Landscapes classroom at Phipps Conservatory and Botanical Gardens. Over delicious small-plates and light refreshments, a discipline or behavior will be identified — often by an expert guest speaker — and discussed among the participants in the interest of sharing ideas and identifying opportunities. With your direction, we hope to expand the schedule to include off-site trips to biophilic regional destinations like nature preserves, green buildings, and urban gardens, and to plan and enact initiatives in our own community to make things better for people and the planet. Join the movement!
results.name: Biophilia: Pittsburgh

results.description:
Philosophical Self-Inquiry

This group is dedicated to Philosophical Self Inquiry. We have met regularly for more than a decade. What is unique about this group is the format we use to explore this topic. This is not a discussion group. For periods of about twenty minutes per participant the group members will ask questions of one participant. These questions are used to express Genuine Interest in the person in order to help them on their path of self inquiry. This is not a therapy group. There is a rotating group leader and it is their task to ask to assure that no question is leading or having an agenda of any kind. No one is trying to solve problems for anyone else. We attend the group to support each other’s self inquiry. For many people this format is challenging and takes several meetings to learn, but it is a format that we have found to be successful and useful over the course of many years. If you are genuinely interested in the topic of Philosophical Self Inquiry, with an ultimate goal of self enlightenment please join us.
results.name: Philosophical Self-Inquiry Discussion Group

results.description:
Do you long to develop and cultivate new friendships with other like minded women?  Our group is special and unique and for those women no matter her place in life.  This meet is for those women who are willing and able to share and be open about her thoughts and feelings about her journey in life.  Whether you are a working,  retired , new to the Pittsburgh area and want to make some authentic friendships,  single, married, divorced, in a new place in life, struggling with a new job or looking for a new one, in a new marriage or relationship, dealing with a death of a loved one, celebrating a new change or on the course of an exciting new endeavor,  we are a group to celebrate your mile stones,  and share your life's journey. 

Our group is not for everyone, this is a serious look at our lives, there are moments of authentic happiness and struggles.  if you are uncomfortable about being REAL in your journey and not sharing about it,  this is not a group for you.  This is NOT a therapy or bitch session, no cattiness permitted, only support and smiles. It is a place where we have committed to be private about each other's life.  This is your own circle and new circle of special friendships, one where it is "your" own special place of "women share".  I would advise should you join you allow this group to be the one place you can go that is your "circle of trust", this is how I look at my wonderful group of women, some have been with me since the start.  

Our Meets meet once a month at the Eat-N-Park in Robinson Town.  Typically on the second or third Sunday.  There are occasions where we participate in activities with each other and they will be posted, but I find from the past, a commitment to one day a month works  best as we all seem to have such busy lives.  Commitment is what works best in my group, you can "drop-in" but you will be asked to participate and add to the conversation.  

We do have a guide book we use in our group and that book is written by Valorie Burton "Happy Women Live Better" .  She discusses 13 "Happiness Triggers" and those "Triggers" are used for a topic around our conversations.  She is a role model for me and her positivity and spiritual heart is what guided me to form this group. 

Our Meet Up's will be once a month, there is a $10.00 yearly fee to join and our monthly meets are held at the Eat n Park in Robinson Township. There is a minimum food purchase requirement to keep the room.   

Please keep in mind that this Meet-up is not a "networking" group or a place or "opportunity to market a/your business". This meet-up was organized solely  for support, encouragement and empowerment.

Here are the Guidelines:

-There is a $10.00 per YEAR membership fee, even if you do not participate in an activity. This is to cover our monthly meet-up fee. Instructions for payment will follow after joining.  

-No soliciting or marketing of products or services permitted at our meets.  This meet is for empowerment and support for the women in our group only. We will always stay on the topics listed in Valorie’s book.  Whoever sends out endorsement e-mails to the group or comes to a meet selling or endorsing a product will be banned immediately.


. 

-Please let the facilitator guide the meeting and topic that is her job.  When you are sharing, be aware of the time you’re speaking, keep to topic, be articulate, and please do not interrupt while someone else is speaking.  Please do not feel you have to raise your hand, this is not a classroom, and it is a conversation, just chime in.  



Please understand that this meet is a group effort, although I founded it, it takes a team to make it work and I can’t do it myself. Your help is very much noticed and appreciated. 

Thank you, and hope to meet you soon. 

Women's Journey Facilitator

Colleen Amos_Mezinze

results.description:
Growing krunchy kidz is a group of natural Mommas raising our krunchy kidz :)

Our group spends regular and quality time with one another, supporting a natural lifestyle, growing and learning from one another.

We are understanding that everyone is traveling their own path on this natural journey. Our Mommas are in all different places and with what works best for their family. Interests among our group include, but are not limited to; organic gardening, cooking, and preserving, attachment parenting, green living, homeschooling, holistic medicine, homesteading, ect.... 

WHERE DOES IT ALL HAPPEN? 

We have Mommas from North, South, East, West, and central of Pittsburgh. Really! You have to have transportation and be comfortable with a little bit of travel time some of the time for our group. 

Growing krunchy kidz meetsall over Pittsburgh and all over the surrounding suburbs. We have no boundaries and this is what makes us, us! This part of our world provides so many opportunities that go beyond our own neighborhoods and we take advantage of all possible venues!

WHAT KEEPS US BUSY?

We offer a lot and a wide variety of meetups and activities for all ages of krunchy kidz (and Mommas!) ALL YEAR AROUND! At this time most all of our meetups occur during the weekdays/daytime (with family friendly events being offered on weekends).

Examples of meetups are; home play, potlucks, homeschool focused activities, exploring  new parks, indoor play,  hikes, farm visits, spray parks, swimming, festivals, farm visits, museums, camping, "how to" demonstrations, birthday parties, exchanges, Moms nights out, family meetups and whatever else you can think up! 

We like to pack up, head out, and enjoy the day :)

HOW CAN YOU JOIN THE TRIBE? 

We are seeking out Mommas and Children that want to be involved. Our preferred smaller group of natural Mommas and children are active members. This is important to our group as we strive for connection. We want to implement stable relationships for ourselves as well as our children. This does not mean you have to attend everything ;)

***We ask that you attend 1 meetup with the first month of joining.***

DUES: 

growing krunchy kidz has a modest (annual) membership fee of 10$ and we feel that your contribution is totally worth what all this group provides. It mostly covers the fee of meetup. Extra funds return to the group :)  

Just in case.....Memership dues are non-refundable and the group has the right to discontinue membership at any time. Also, please note that all meetups attended you are responsible, as well as liable for your child and their safety. Being a member of the group means that you understand and agree to these terms.
results.name: growing krunchy kidz

results.description:
Heartfulness is a way of living. A simple and practical way to experience the heart’s unlimited resources. In mindfulness we still the mind and in heartfulness we fill the heart. Whether you are seeking relaxation, an individual meditation practice, or the deepest connection to your inner being, Heartfulness Pittsburgh welcomes you.

Heartfulness Meditation is a simple, practical technique that you can use alongside to any other form of yoga, meditation or spiritual practice. In a few minutes, you will learn how to truly relax and feel the lightness and joy of your true nature. You don’t need to know how to meditate or to believe in a particular system or philosophy. The Heartfulness technique shows us to gently turn our attention towards our heart and experience that inner presence for ourselves.

We are a global not-for-profit organization with the mission of uplifting the hearts of the communities we serve.

All teaching and methods are free.

Heartfulness International website: www.heartfulness.org

Heartfulness Pittsburgh website: https://www.facebook.com/heartfulnesspittsburgh/
results.name: Heartfulness Pittsburgh

results.description:
Boardgames are so different from what you may remember. We typically are not talking about the Parker Brothers and Milton Bradley games from your youth, when there were only a relative few games out there. Today's boardgames come in different themes, sizes, durations, components, and objectives. They come from all over the world, too. Our group plays just about all the kinds you may find. Some examples of the types of games we often play are...


Party games like: Codenames, Spyfall, Camel Up, and Dixit.


Euro style games like: Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico,Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep.


Abstract games like: Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive.


Card games like: Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, and Munchkin


Dice games like Pickomino, Qwixx, and Roll for the Galaxy 


Cooperative games like: Pandemic, Forbidden Desert, and Shadows Over Camelot.


Family games Like: Carcassonne, Catan, Istanbul, Splendor, Lanterns, and Machi Koro.


American Thematic/Ameritrash games like: Blood Rage, Arkham Horror, and Bootleggers


So our members certainly have diverse tastes in games. And they are diverse people. We welcome folks from all walks of life, and we host the young and the middle aged, as well as some of the older folks, but all seem to have a great time when we get together! If you have kids, bring them if you plan on keeping an eye on them. Kids, adults, as long as everyone behaves, we are glad to see all of you!


Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players. We try to pick and teach games that might be appropriate to your skill level, and that we think you might enjoy. Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby. We know not everyone loves every game, but I bet we can find at least one game for anyone. We have plenty of games. What we need to make is more gamers.


If there is a game that you would like to try out, just RSVP to one of our meetup events and suggest it down in the comments for that event. Chances are that one of us has it in our collection, and we can bring it out with us.


The spaces we utilize tend to have tables that would not be very satisfying to someone who wants to play a Miniatures Game or a Roleplaying Game. We know folks that are for sure interested in playing them; we often just don't have the space. We do have Discussion Forums that can be a place for you to arrange a spot and time to get some of those games played.


There is often no admission to attend our events in public places. We just hope you support the businesses that allow us to use their facilities with your patronage.


RSVPs are very appreciated, and allow us to know to not cancel an event. It is not a big deal if you need to change your RSVP later on, and do drop in last minute if that's how life is working out for you. It just really only takes one person other than the host to say they are certainly in. Hosts would hate to sit there alone with two bags of games like a dope, wouldn't they?


If you have ideas for venues and towns in which to hold an event, please do contact Our Co-organizer or Organizer. We know there are a lot of towns that hope to game, that are missing good events on the map.


For the time being, We currently meet at :


The Giant Eagle Market District at Settlers Ridge in the Robinson/Moon area on the First, the Third, and possibly the Fifth Friday nights of each month

The Kings Restaurant in Canonsburg on the Second and Fourth Friday nights of every month.

And The Giant Eagle Market District Express in McMurray/Upper St. Clair on Saturdays at least monthly


Take a look at our  Pages tab above to find a Link to our directory of  Game collections and BoardGameGeek.com profiles.


Co-Organizer: Andy Welsbacher ('ol Redbeard)


Organizer; Russell Griffin (Russ)
results.name: Western PA Gaming

results.description:
Have you ever read about a technology, framework, or programming language and thought, "I'm going to use that for my next project!" Time passes, and you never seem to get a chance to try it out.

We've all been there. Technology is an ever-changing landscape and it seems nearly impossible to keep up with it all. It's so easy to stick with what you know, especially when you need to build quickly. And the day job isn't exactly the place to keep your personal sandbox. Well here's your excuse to finally try those exciting new technologies you keep reading about. Don't let your skills go to waste. Try New Tech. That's what this meetup is all about.

The format? We'll have a 30-minute presentation on a specific topic, followed by a set of challenges set up by the organizers to get your hands dirty and really drive the point home. Yes, you'll need to bring a laptop. If you let us know ahead of time, we'll do our best to get you one.

Interested in presenting? Send an email to present@trynewtech.com. Sometimes a little social pressure from a public commitment can be just the thing you need to pick up something new. We encourage you to take advantage of this meetup. The organizers will even help you create some engaging challenges.
results.name: Try New Tech

Consisting of Docker Engine, a portable, lightweight runtime and packaging tool, and Docker Hub, a cloud service for sharing applications and automating workflows, Docker enables apps to be quickly assembled from components and eliminates the friction between development, QA, and production environments. As a result, IT can ship faster and run the same app, unchanged, on laptops, data center VMs, and any cloud.

Learn more about Docker at http://www.docker.com

topics.name: The Open Web Application Security Project

results.description:
Pittsburgh Chapter of the globally recognized Open Web Application Security Project. 

The OWASP Foundation came online on December 1st 2001 it was established as a not-for-profit charitable organization in the United States on April 21, 2004 to ensure the ongoing availability and support for our work at OWASP. OWASP is an international organization and the OWASP Foundation supports OWASP efforts around the world. OWASP is an open community dedicated to enabling organizations to conceive, develop, acquire, operate, and maintain applications that can be trusted. All of the OWASP tools, documents, forums, and chapters are free and open to anyone interested in improving application security. We advocate approaching application security as a people, process, and technology problem because the most effective approaches to application security include improvements in all of these areas. We can be found at www.owasp.org. 


OWASP is a new kind of organization. Our freedom from commercial pressures allows us to provide unbiased, practical, cost-effective information about application security. OWASP is not affiliated with any technology company, although we support the informed use of commercial security technology. Similar to many open-source software projects, OWASP produces many types of materials in a collaborative, open way. The OWASP Foundation is a not-for-profit entity that ensures the project's long-term success.
results.name: OWASP Pittsburgh Chapter

results.description:
Many people use Computer Aided Design, CAD, software for product design and various forms of manufacture, specifically using AutoCAD, the industry standard CAD package.  Over time, AutoCAD has been extended to provide 3D Modeling capability, but this functionality is limited because the software was originally developed to be an extension of 2D drafting.

Starting from the ground up, the makers of AutoCAD have developed AutoDesk Inventor, a 3D modeling software package specifically designed to meet the needs of 3D Computer Aided Manufacture, or CAM.  The basis of Inventor is that it uses parametric modeling, a powerful design innovation that allows parts to defined by their dimensions instead of dimensioned after the design process is complete.  The use of parametric modeling in AutoDesk Inventor is similar to another software package, Solidworks.

However, the challenge of using a tool as powerful as AutoDesk Inventor is that because it uses a new design paradigm, it can be challenging to learn.  To facilitate training in the many features of Inventor, representatives from AutoDesk and members of TechShop have started this Meetup here in Pittsburgh PA.  Our goal is to bring together members of the design community to form a study group to learn this powerful software.

The structure of the study group is to work through an Inventor training manual covering one topic per week as described in the syllabus.  For members of this group, portions of the study guide will be posted in advance of each meeting.  There will be no fixed lecturer, instead members of the group are encouraged to sign up to speak on the weekly topic, and every member is encouraged to share their expertise.  We will meet in the computer classroom at TechShop at Bakery Square, one of the premier makerspaces nationally, now with nine locations across the country.

We look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Pittsburgh AutoDesk Inventor & CAD/CAM, study group

The group will be holding different activities such as: Brunches, Lunches, Dinners, Happy Hours, Movies, Live Bands , Karaoke, Casino trips, Spa Events, Medium Readings, Meet and Greets and Speed Friending Events.   The Meet Up for the meals will always be held for 8-10 people.  There are a few reasons for that: 1.  Most People prefer a smaller group for meals so they can actually spend time talking to everyone in the group and it is more personal.  There have been many complaints from the Meet Ups that have large groups for the meals because they said that they never even got to talk to anyone and only met the people sitting next to them and have considered it to be very impersonal.  I prefer to keep it at  a smaller group for that very reason.   2.  A lot of restaurants are not in favor of handling a group that is very large for these events.  However, there will always be events that will allow Open House/Open Membership to EVERYONE or there will be events where there will be 20 or 30 members or maybe just 8 or 10.  Please remember you can always sign up for the "want a spot" and keep checking for any cancellations.  You are always welcome!  The group will ALWAYS be held in the Aspinwall/Fox Chapel area ONLY.   This group is a great bunch of people who enjoy having FUN and who enjoy meeting new people.  Remember....that is what it is all about.   I'm really looking forward to meeting you : )

results.description:
Reality Computing is a high-level concept in computing technology that integrates the digital and physical worlds. In Reality Computing, many different products and technologies are brought together in order to Capture, Create, and Deliver data and objects. Reality Computing technologies allow users to digitally capture the existing conditions of objects and locations (laser scanning, photogrammetry, depth cameras), compute and analyze that captured data in design software, and then realize, or create, the result back either physically (3D printing, digital manipulation) or visually (augmented reality, projection techniques). 

This group is for anyone interested in innovative technology that is changing the future. We will be having Meetup events during which representatives from successful Reality Computing companies will be speaking. Hope to see you around, and meanwhile if you want to know more check out http://realitycomputing.typepad.com.

results.description:
If you are interested in improving your life AND having a greater positive impact on the world, Group Genie may be for you!  At our meeting, you can: get support for your personal goals, build skills, do networking, and celebrate progress and life appreciations. You also can help our creativity team to develop new and powerful methods to help humanity.  Some people help through special skills they have (for instance, graphic design or acting in a video) but most people can help by testing out and using some of the powerful tools already created or in development.

Tim Cimino, the founder, has invented a wide range of materials.  Many are self-help and skill-building materials; but others help people do more good; become political empowered (nonpartisan); or develop a more world-sustaining lifestyle.

A big theme that we encourage people to reflect on is the question, "What is the best, most loving use of my time and life?"  Tim's answer to that question is to create powerful new methods that can be used around the world.  Other people can help his work, and can often improve their lives and help others -- all at the same time!

Much more information and many materials can be found at GroupGenie.Org.

Here's Tim describing the meet-up format (4:04)

results.description:
This is a group for people interested in Christian Apologetics.

What is Apologetics you may ask?

Apologetics: “That aspect of Christian theology which seeks to set out and demonstrate the credibility and plausibility of the Christian Faith” (Alister McGrath in The J.I. Packer Collection).

Apologetics is about analyzing and defending what Christians believe, why they believe it, and asking whether or not Christianity is true and makes logical sense. Its okay to ask the tough questions, all is fair game.

Every evangelist should be an apologist. The evangelist shares the gospel with people, and the apologist tries to convince people that the gospel is true and real.

Apologetics is as old as the Bible and ancient Greek philosophers. The word itself was made famous in the book of  1 Peter. "But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an apologia to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear" 

Apologetics is about taking an honest look at Christianity and asking, "Is this stuff real?", "Did Jesus really exist?", "Is there any historic, logical, philosophic, and scientific merit to Christianity?" Its Christianity for the deep and thinking person. Its Christianity for the skeptic and agnostic. In the end, the skeptic may, or may not, become a believer, that is their choice. But at least the facts are clearly analyzed and presented.

Take a look at this 2 minute video for an excellent explanation.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RAFlmuiA-eE


What will this meetup group do and accomplish?

This group is for discussion and debate about religion and Christianity, and also a book club for apologetics authors such as: Ravi Zacharias, JP Moreland, Alister McGrath, John Lennox, Os Guinness, William Lane Craig, Phil Fernandez, CS Lewis, and anyone from the Veritas forum, or any other apologetics author/speaker people are interested in.

Books by skeptics and atheists will also be read in order to give an honest analysis to their claims and to compare to the claims of apologists.

We will also try and attend debates and Q/A forums at Universities all over the country. Sadly most of these are not in Pittsburgh. Watch this video for an example of such a Q/A session. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M8XSa79sU0M

Basically we watch a difficult video or read a difficult book that challenges Christianity, and we try our best to refute it using apologetics books and materials, logic, common sense, and most importantly the Bible. We talk, a lot. Its mostly about discussion. If you want to listen, thats fine too.

Who should join this group?

If you are interested in the Historic Jesus and Historic Christianity, philosophy, religion in general, or you are a Christian who is either struggling with their faith, or is strong in their faith but wants a deep and serious philosophic discussion about Christianity. Also if you are a believer in another religion or faith, or agnostic, or atheist, and would like to discuss Christianity or religion in general. 

Christians, people of non-Christian faiths, skeptics, and atheists are all welcome!!!

When and where do we meet?

We meet in the Squirrel Hill library community room. Sometimes its a Panera Bread instead, depending on community room availability. As of right now, we either meet in the Squirrel Hill library or in the Shadyside Panera Bread.

We meet once a month. The meetings are 2 hours long and usually on Saturday at 11am. We usually have some assignment to complete before each meeting, such as watch a video, read part of a book, read an article, etc. During the meetings we discuss the assignment, watch videos, have formal debates between theists and atheists, and just talk about the subject of the assignment.
results.name: Pittsburgh Christian Apologetics Group

results.description: Sunday Assembly is “a godless congregation that celebrates life”. We are a group of generally non-religious people that get together and listen to a talk, sing some fun pop songs, and eat tea and cake. That’s pretty much it. You can call it “atheist church”, “humanist church”, “secular community”—the labels are not as important is the intention, which is to help each other “live better, help often, and wonder more”. The monthly assembly is our flagship event for celebrating together and nurturing a wider secular community. The idea started in London in January of last year with Sanderson Jones and Pippa Evans, two stand-up comedians that decided they wanted the best parts of church/synagogue/mosque/faith-community “without the god bit”. They put the idea out to their community and got such an overwhelmingly positive response that the thing went a little bit viral, with 30 assemblies popping up worldwide practically overnight. Since then the thing has gone way viral, with about 80 new assemblies working to launch in September. “Well doesn’t my city already have a dozen secular groups and a few Unitarian churches?” I hear you asking yourselves? Yes, and thank goodness for that. We love these groups. We are not in competition with traditional secular organizations but instead hope to complement, energize and enliven them. The intellectual and cerebral aspect of our average secular groups is very important and indispensable, but it doesn’t often leverage the positive power of emotion, music and poetry, or just enjoying ourselves as a group. Also, the assembly format is very accessible to families with children and seems to attract a variety of ages. Come check us out!
results.name: Sunday Assembly Pittsburgh

results.description:
Welcome to our meet-up group for those with fibromyalgia and autoimmune diseases. This group is for anyone interested in talking about things that have helped and hurt their conditions. 

 Disclaimer: The people in this group are not necessarily medical professionals. Never add or eliminate medication or other treatments without first consulting your doctor or prescribing medical professional.


1. The goal of this group is not to sit in a circle in the basement of a local church drinking stale coffee holding a pity party for everyone! We are not less of a human being because nature decided to play a cruel joke on us. This group is here to provide us an opportunity to socialize with others who understand us. We have monthly(ish) Skype meetings and in-person meetings. There will also be opportunities to walk in local fundraising walk/5k and educational meetings.

2. The exercise meetings are not hosted by anyone in particular. They are there to give people the opportunity to exercise with someone else who has similar health issues. If you want to go, sign up even if no one else says they are going. Sometimes it takes one person to start the trend. 

3. I LOVE getting new ideas and suggestions! Please do not hesitate to contact me. The only way I can schedule activities people want to do is if I know what those activities are and when is a good time to schedule them.

4. Meetup.com charges $15/month for use of their website. At some point you may be asked to participate in a fundraiser to help raise funds to pay for the monthly fees.

Keep in mind that you will get out of this as much as you put into it. I hope you find it beneficial!

<3 Jessi, with a big nod to the author, Amy ;-)
results.name: Fibromyalgia and Auto Immune Diseases

results.description: This group will be meeting once a month at the Fox Chapel Waterworks Mall at Panera. This group is for anyone who has suffered a loss and is grieving.  We will be meeting in the Conference Room so we will have privacy and the opportunity to share. This could be due to a recent loss or a loss from many years ago and you may have pain that has resurfaced for any reason. Please note that I am not a grief counselor but what I do know is that I have lost 13 family members in 13 years and 2 of them were children. I lost 15 friends in 10 years. I lost them due to illness, accidents and suicide. My heart has been repeatedly broken but I do know that the heart can and will heal and I believe that we can do this together. I have attended several grief support groups over the years and I can tell you that by telling your story and helping others....you also, will begin to heal. I believe that it is a great help and part of the healing process to just sit back, talk, listen, share and be a part of a group that "just gets it." Coping skills is another great topic of discussion. Believe me...it really does and will help you to talk to others that "have walked that road." We are all in this together as one.  I would also like this to be an opportunity for you to grab something to eat or a coffee.  I just wanted to let you know that you will have time to do that if you would like to purchase something.   I look forward to meeting you.      Jan
results.name: Pittsburgh Grief Support Meetup

results.description:
Welcome to the Pittsburgh Collaborative Writers Meetup

As is said in varying ways, the tools of communication change, but the ideas remain the same.  In this day, we have access to a writing tool unlike those available in the past: Google Docs.  This technology gives us new options for authorship, although in many ways the craft of writing has not changed.

Google Docs is a free online tool that allows two or more people to edit the same document at the time and see the changes that the other person is making as they are being made.  Having this functionality allows for an immediacy of collaboration between writers in different locations in a way that could not have happened in the past.  As the word processor improved the craft of writing by making revisions easier, the question now is, how does this new tool change the way we communicate using the written word.

This is a group for writers of all styles and all experience levels.  I have been a professional technical writer for more than ten years, serving as a journalist, writing content for the web, writing computer manuals, and writing fiction for my own amusement.  I look forward to using the tools of collaboration to help others:

*  Learn to be more creative
*  Overcome writers' block
*  And to write more effectively

During the Meetup we will write together, read what we have written, and collaboratively edit each other’s writing.  The goal of this group will be to improve our communication with each other and with our intended audiences.  As I would hope for other members of the group, I aspire to being accepting of all recommendations about my writing as I strive to produce the best product that I can.

Each participant will need a laptop or tablet for every Meetup.  You will also need a free Google email address if you do not already have one.

We look forward to seeing you there.
results.name: Pittsburgh Writers Meetup

results.description: The WESTMORELAND ENTREPRENEURS is a business networking group which is limited to one person per profession.  It was created by a core group of business professionals who were excellent at their professions, had integrity and a strong sense of community who wanted to meet other professionals who had the same excellence and integrity.  This core group of individuals was tired of spending too much time attending networking functions which turned out to be simply social functions which produced little to no leads or referrals.  They were also tired of spending hard earned capital to a networking machine that cranked out rules and regulations instead of goodwill and bonding between members.  What they created was a recipe for creating success.  With a little structure, a cup of relaxation and a pinch of fun, WESTMORELAND ENTREPRENEURS has become a terrific group of professionals dedicated to finding referrals for their fellow members and helping one another be as successful as they can be at their professions.

results.description: “Board games for the upwardly mobile” - CNN/Money IT'S TIME TO GET OUT OF THE RAT RACE What's your dream? Freedom of time? Unlimited resources to travel the world? Whatever it may be, CASHFLOW® 101 the Board Game teaches you how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the Fast Track, where your money works for you instead of you working hard for your money. This group is for everyone who wants to play Cashflow and ... •Wants to enhance their financial awareness through playing Cashflow 101 and 202 •Wants to increase their financial literacy •Wants to meet others with entrepreneurial spirits •Is looking for inspiration and wants to meet others on the same track •Wants to meet other positive and like minded people •Has read any books like those by Robert Kiyosaki (e.g. Rich Dad Poor Dad) •Knows about the Kiyosaki Quadrants and desires to move out of the rat race •Wants to have FUN playing the Cashflow board game OR is just curious about what this is all about! Then come along. No experience is necessary. This group is FREE to attend and FREE coaching is provided on how to play the Cashflow game.   Use this game to practice real world investing with play money! Plan your strategy with Opportunity Cards that include Big and Small Deals! Choose your dream, learn the secrets of the rich, and get on the financial fast track! CASHFLOW® 101 is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time - and makes learning fun!
results.name: Pittsburgh CashFlow Club

This is a group that is committed to pursuing spiritual growth in the context of caring, loving, and authentic relationships. All are welcome to attend regardless of your religious beliefs or level of Bible knowledge. About 20-30 of us meet for food, fellowship, Bible discussion, and prayer.

On Sunday evenings, at 5:00pm, the group shares snacks and refreshments together and then discusses a passage of the Bible from 5:30-6:30pm. Guests are always welcomed and are never put “on the spot” in any way. Childcare is provided, and the environment is casual.  We meet at Stewart Avenue Lutheran Church, 2810 Brownsville Road in Pittsburgh.

For more information, please visit http://redeeminggracepittsburgh.com/community-bible-study

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in the inexhaustible wisdom of Tao Te Ching. Ancient Chinese spiritual-philosophical text, Tao Te Ching, revealed the mystical truth of human life and provided extremely wise and precious guidance in regard to human living. However, as the content is so profound and the text so succinct that by nature this text has become as a pure “white light” and that all its individual readers throughout the past 2600 yrs. history could only perceive certain aspects of its reflected “seven colors,” meeting what is described in its text “Nature is like a bellows, Empty, yet never ceasing its supply when moving.” We hope, through mutual sharing of personal understanding of this text, group members of us all can be benefited in the growth of our personal spiritual pursuits as well as the improvement of our lives in terms of well-being and happiness.

results.description:
The Cost to attend? $0.00 BUT we do ask that you help us attract the most diverse (industry and background) set of entrepreneurs and create the most inclusive environment - this means inviting and bringing people, not just attending and participating.  

You can help us spread the word on Twitter or on Instagram or anywhere you can publish www.UnstuckPittsburgh.com using #UnstuckPgh 

Guidelines for the meet up: 

1) Be on time, when you come in late (after 7:55AM) then you cause a disruption for everyone who got there on time.  Parents get a pass if they had to send someone off to school but otherwise please make best efforts to be early (help set up), get coffee, use the restroom, etc before we start.

2) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

3) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St.  

Want the weekly Pittsburgh entrepreneurship events emailed to you?  bit.ly/Boomtahn
results.name: #UnstuckPgh - free weekly lessons taught by entrepreneurs

results.description: Hmmm. This is an invitation to join me in gathering together like-minded women who've experienced life for a while :) and are in pursuit of similar interests as I. I am an ardent student of A Course In Miracles; Quantum Physics and especially a dedicated practice of the application of its principles; the pursuit of clear consciousness and lucidity; the practices of breathing (refer to Max Strom); the acquiring of wisdom (refer to Jesus, Buddha, Mohammed, Krishna, Sufi, Anais Nin, Steve Treu, Gary Zukav, Deepak Chopra to name a few); yoga (I'm very new to it but enthusiastic about its physical and spiritual rewards); the offering of compassion and kindness; and complete responsibility for self. This isn't a therapeutic nor venting outlet but rather a discovery and growth arena. I am forming this potential meetup because as I've progressed I am finding that most of my good old friends (whom I still and will always value) are not on the same page as I am and I'd like to connect with new friends who may be on the same page or at least reading the same book (metaphorically speaking). I live in the North Hills of Pittsburgh and am happy to travel southeast and north up to an hour for gatherings. At this point, I have not set a specific meeting time because my first step is finding women who are interested in such a pursuit. So if you are interested, please send me a note. Thank you very much. Debra Holz, 412-651-5051

results.description:
Welcome! This is a group dedicated to educational meet-ups in the southwestern region of PA, learning to identify and sustainably utilize local plants for healing and for eating. I will be offering educational plant walks in the area and classes on how to make the most from local plants and "weeds." Many of these "weeds" are found in our own yards or nearby, and many of them have been found to help us heal a number of common ailments. You may be surprised what we find right in our.... neck of the woods!

I am also highly interested in sharing the value of the local natural areas with the community, as they are an invaluable part of our day-to-day life, even if we don't see or notice them regularly.  I plan to help conserve what areas I possibly can, as what we call "progress" continues to creep into our already very limited natural spaces, creating more light pollution and more traffic and wildlife problems more often than it should be.  But I need your help to do this.  I enjoy sharing these plant walks and classes and hope that the community, if not already awakened to the need to conserve this land, will awaken and see what is beneath our very feet, and that we need to protect it to truly survive.

Thank you for your interest in this group-- please contact me with any questions, ideas, or comments!

Green Blessings!
results.name: Southwest PA Wild Edible and Medicinal Plants Group

results.description:
Welcome to the Pittsburgh Chapter of the Product Development and Management Association (PDMA). We are a professional association dedicated to improving the effectiveness of individuals and organizations involved with product development, product management, and innovation. The Pittsburgh Chapter is committed to building product innovation knowledge in the Pittsburgh region by creating a vibrant community of practitioners, academics and service providers to share experiences.

Throughout the year, we sponsor educational and social events where you can develop new skills, learn best practices, and network with your peers. Join our Meetup group to find out about upcoming events! 


Our Mission

The Pittsburgh Chapter is dedicated to sharing knowledge and best practices through professional development, education, collaboration, and networking opportunities. We strive to build a vibrant community of practitioners, academics, and service providers that share experiences and knowledge of the principles, practices, and processes of effective product innovation.  Participation in this community will result in professional growth for individuals, an innovation related competitive advantage for their enterprises and the continued economic growth of the Western Pennsylvania Region.
results.name: PDMA Pittsburgh

The “Polish Pittsburgh Meet up” is for anyone who is interested in all things Polish. This group is being organized by the Polish Cultural Council of western Pennsylvania (PCC), a 200 plus member organization (polishculturalcouncil.org) whose sole mission is to bring to the audiences of western PA the best in contemporary Polish culture, whether it's film, art, language, lectures, cuisine and much, much more. 

We aim to share, explore, and join the conversations of modern Poland- addressing issues important and interesting in the context of Poland today. This meetup will serve as a platform for meetings with Poles, Polish Americans and those simply interested in Polish culture in a number of settings and formats. If you are interested in Polish history, genealogy, food, foreign policy, etc., we will be regularly hosting and creating events to share and learn about these topics . 

Interested in contemporary Polish music? Learning Polish? Film? Cuisine? Let’s meet up and start the conversation!

results.description:
Hello, After discovering that the Big Data Developers Group only allowed for IBM-sponsored events to be shared, I thought I'd start a new agnostic MeetUp group where anybody can post the events they're holding on topics relevant to the Big Data ecosystem. While I am currently a product manager at MapR, I welcome all interested parties to share events within the Pittsburgh Big Data community and post questions, comments, and jobs.

Key interests right now within the ecosystem are the emergence of in-memory analytics like Spark, Streams and Kafka; security best practices concerning kerberos, TLS, encryption, and database security (Apache Sentry); and what's next for Hadoop in this very fast-paced world.
results.name: Pittsburgh Big Data Meetups

results.description:
Welcome to the Sports Monster Pittsburgh Softball Meetup!

This group is for anyone and everyone who wants to play softball with a social, friendly group of people. We welcome everyone from total beginners to very advanced, and everyone gets to play with people of their own skill level.

We promote a club atmosphere where you can play tons of softball, meet tons of new friends and have a great time. It is our mission to get as many people playing softball in Pittsburgh as possible. So whether you are an old pro, or have never picked up a bat before - we are the place for you. Come along and check us out!

What can I expect to find here?

Well run programming. You want to have fun but also play in something that is well run from seasonal leagues, one day tournaments to social events and some other fun stuff we think might be of interest to you.

We look forward to meeting you and playing some of the most fun softball Pittsburgh has to offer. 

If you have any questions, ideas or just want to get involved, please contact pittsburgh.info@sportsmonster.net

results.description: In 1988, six friends who reunited in Pittsburgh formed a group to contribute to the community – a movement that officially marks the beginning of PYP. Now with over 400 members and 27 years of experience, PYP has aided in the social, professional, and civic development of young professionals in the Pittsburgh region. We continue to provide career minded individuals with opportunities to develop socially, professionally, and civically.

results.description: The Pittsburgh Polymer Clay Guild (PPCG) is a group of polymer clay enthusiasts who share a love for this medium. Our members have varying levels of expertise and experience. Our guild welcomes everyone from tentative beginners to professionals. Our mission is to advance knowledge and develop proficiency among Guild members in the use of polymer clay through the exchange of experience and ideas. We do this by supporting and enjoying each others' talents through clay days, an annual retreat, workshops, group shows, and information sharing. Come visit and see what we're all about.

results.description: We are a group of enthusiasts, collectors, shooters, and professionals interested in the apolitical discussion of firearms use and thchnology. We'd like to meet a couple times a month to discuss everything from the origins of gunpowder to the future of small arms in the tech age. results.description: Do you sometimes ride half fast? :-) Come as you are...it's about the journey, not the speed... We are a kinder, gentler bicycle club for anyone who wants to pedal; meet fun, laid-back cyclists. We occasionally end with a beverage or snack. Just starting out? We have experienced folks willing to help! Got kids? Multi-family rides can be a great way to make new friends while staying active! Happy to just get out and pedal as we enjoy sunshine? So are we!! We are hoping to partner with other laid-back clubs or local bike shops to promote ongoing and upcoming social rides already on the calendar. We are happy to share information to make sure our Half Fast cyclists have as many social cycling options as possible. Where do we ride? We are always looking for scenic, safe and low vehicle traffic areas wherever you want! This group is for riders all over the area so we can hopefully find groups of social riders convenient to you! Know of a great stretch of trail in your area, suggest a meet-up! This is your group!! Hope to see you out there!!

results.description:
The fear of public speaking is a very common fear for just about everyone.
Few people ever work towards eliminating their fear of public speaking until it is too late... such as; one week before they have to deliver a speech to a room of strangers.

Learn how to eliminate your fear of speaking: In Public, In Business, In Life.

Perfecting your communication and leadership skill offers you a greater chance of promotion, better pay, access to social networking opportunities and being respected by others.

A CALL TO ACTION:
Think of the worst career that you would never want to do for a living, then ask yourself, "What one life skill is holding this person back (who has this job) from attaining a more rewarding career". The answer to this question is ALWAYS; Better communication skills!
results.name: The Fear Of Public Speaking

topics.name: Physical and Emotional Balance with Essential Oil

results.description:
Hello! Welcome to the South Hills Young Living Essential Oils Meetup Group. Here you will meet other people interested in alternative health and naturopathic healing via therapeutic grade essential oils. 

Young Living Essential Oils are the industry leaders in essential oils. In fact, they are the industry standard oils with massage therapists and in many alternative healing practices. They are the only oils allowed to be used in Raindrop Technique, an emerging therapy. See below for more information. They are also used in hospitals throughout the U.S. They are even used intravenously in the Nova Vita clinic in Ecuador. They are very different than food-grade and perfume-grade essential oils (EOs) sold in many health food stores. Most health food store essential oils and other "knock off" companies are either synthetic, a few molecules are changed, cut with alcohol and other ingredients or are distilled quickly at high temperatures for fast, mass production, hence making the oils more affordably appealing, yet with no healing properties. 

Young Living Essential Oils are true therapeutic-grade EOs. In fact, Gary Young coined the term therapeutic-grade for essential oils. They are the purest grade EOs on the market. They are the essence, the blood, the life force, the immune system of the tree, plant, shrub, bush, flower, fruit, seed, etc. Many households are learning how to replace many of their "over-the-counters" as well as prescription medications with therapeutic grade EOs. Children are learning to come to mommy or daddy for their lavender or peppermint oil when they need to be wound down or have a tummy ache! In fact, many pet lovers as well as veterinarian offices are working with the oils as well, with incredible success! Note: you only want to use true therapeutic-grade essential oils on your pets for safety purposes. 

Did you know that Young Living Essential Oils are the only oils allowed to be used in Raindrop Technique, a revolutionary way to bring balance and harmony to the body...physically, mentally, and emotionally. It is an emerging therapy in many massage therapist's offices, spas, alternative medicine clinics, etc. Raindrop Technique was created more than a decade ago. The molecules of therapeutic-grade EOs are so small they are the only substance on the planet which may actually cross the blood-brain barrier. You do not have to be a certified Raindrop Therapist to learn the technique or to give it to family and friends. You can also learn Raindrop to help boost your family and friend's immunity, such as during our cold winter months, by giving them Raindrop Technique. An additional note, oils for healing, cleansing and masach (hebrew word for anoint, which means to smear, spread or massage) are mentioned more than 250 times in the bible. There is an answer for everything through nature. Essential oils have been used for healing/medicinal purposes since the beginning of time. 

Thank you for spending the time to get to know a little bit about Therapeutic-Grade Essential Oils and their incredible benefits! 

We are looking forward to "Meetup" with all of you! 

To your Health & Well Being, 

Sharon Bovalina, Young Living Essential Oils 

Member # 1818592


* None of the statements on this site have been evaluated by the FDA. The information provided is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

results.description:
Do you want to learn to be more outgoing? Do you want to leave your conform zone and master the art of small talk? Do you want to become the center of attention? Do you value personality over integrity? If you answered YES to any of these questions then this group is NOT for you.

Welcome to the Introverts of Pittsburgh Meet-up!

The purpose of this group is to provide introverts with a low-key environment to share ideas and company with each other. We will not tell you that you need to be more outgoing, but we will support you if that is the direction you want to go. There is nothing wrong with being an introvert and you do not have to change if you do not want to!

This is your group so please join and help make it what YOU want it to be.

results.description:
The Art of War Leadership and Communications (L/C) Community

A place to go where liked minded people can discuss ideas in business and self improvement.

Whether you are new to leadership or an experience veteran this community is self sustained by the sharing of advice and personal experiences.

The Purpose of AOWL

To learn from each other. What books, audio or courses have you used to improve your L/C skills?

Let's build strong strategic relationships with each other and learn skills in L/C to make us more productive.

What Members Can Expect

An atmosphere of sharing and interacting ideas. Members can volunteer to present an interactive game on communicating or share a Business book review. Any ideas that will get the group excited about being apart of the community and learning valuable skills.

Who Should Join

If you are serious about your personal and career growth. If you have a need to improve in L/C skills.

If you been a Leader in the past and want to Mentor others, this is the group for you.

results.description: Being a Christian doesn’t mean we can’t have lots of fun and explore beyond the walls of our church. Whether it’s outdoor adventure, a friendly dinner, pick-up sports, bible study, volunteering, or just hanging out by a bonfire, the goal is to create a fun, supportive, open-minded, and inclusive environment without the pressures of religion or affiliation to any particular church. results.description:
Buddhist Forum
Humans tend to seek truth in life. Thus science has advanced and civilization has been enhanced. The truth of life as such and its function (living) should be said the highest and most mysterious subject in this regard. Throughout the human history, many different sources, scientific as well as religious, have all continuously studied from different aspects in order to unveil the truth of such a mystery. However, among them, only what the teachings of Buddha Sakiamuni (Gautama, Siddartha) revealed some 2500 years ago can be said to possess the most rational conviction and to be the most objectively promising. The makeup of human life and its living sustain and continue by means of the law of karmic cause and effect, which may also perfectly explain the reincarnation of a person. Not until the understanding of such mechanism of the process of life should any ultimate Truth, such as Voidness, Love, God, all are One, etc., be substantially meaningful.
    Our Meetup will have two parts. One is to study the fundamental doctrines of Buddhism, the other is for the discussion or sharing of any Buddhist concepts from the comparative-religious point of view. We hope through attending the meeting everybody will get strongly inspired to know to conduct a more meaningful and valuable life.
results.name: Sewickley Buddhist-Forum Meetup

results.description:
FIND YOUR JOY with ATS! This form of Bellydance gives a woman a unique sense of power and beauty and teaches them how to work in harmony with each other. Bonding with women and learning the art and language of this amazing dance form is inspiring to women of all ages , sizes and abilities. Seeing an army of women on stage in full power and glory, flowing together without choreography, so graceful and strong. The friendships help us bond in a community and give you a sense of sisterhood that is much needed in todays society. If you have ever done other tribal styles or fusion dances, chances are, you are using some of our moves already, because they are incorporated into many dance forms. Come and try a class! We welcome you to join us. Beginner classes every Monday at 6:00 … Level Two Classes are Monday at 7:00 (level one vocabulary and basics are prerequisite) Drop ins welcome $15.00 class Prepaid Ten lessons for just 100.00.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-xCqe_Zl5MA&feature=youtu.be

results.description:
This meetup is run by the St. David's Society of Pittsburgh, a group dedicated to promoting and preserving Welsh heritage in Southwestern Pennsylvania. We host several Welsh cultural events throughout the year including pub crawls, a book club, a Gymanfa Ganu (festival of song), and an annual St. David's Day lunch in March. We have a Welsh language class that meets weekly and we collaborate with other cultural groups in Pittsburgh through participation in local folk festivals and our Welsh Nationality Room in the Cathedral of Learning.

Learn more at: https://www.facebook.com/welshsociety.pittsburgh

results.description: HackPittsburgh is a non-profit, community-based workshop that allows members to come together and share skills and tools to pursue creative projects. Our membership is open to everyone but typically comprises inventors, engineers, scientists, programmers, hobbyists, artists, roboteers, families, entrepreneurs, and arts and crafts enthusiasts. Our focus is on collaboration, education, and community outreach. We’re a benevolent group and do not promote or condone illegal activities. The term “hacking” is used in a benign sense, in the context of deconstructing and understanding objects and systems and re-purposing existing materials for new and innovative uses. We have events every Friday night (except for holidays), open to the public, and usually free, where people can come in for interesting talks or presentations and see the shop and what we have to offer. Details on any particular Friday night event are posted to the blog on our main page somewhere between a few days and a week prior to the event. We host several outside groups who meet in our space and whose events are also open to the public. Please visit http://www.hackpittsburgh.org for more information.
results.name: HackPittsburgh

results.description:
This group is for anyone who is or wants to be an entrepreneur and start or run a business. Whether you are a part-time “one-man band” or have been in business for 30 years with hundreds of employees, we all have something to share about struggles of starting a business, keeping revenue flowing and delivering new products to market. You could be just at the “idea” phase, have a product, be in production or successful with many customers. All entrepreneurs struggle with curve balls daily and this meetup is a space where you can talk through ideas and questions you may have while offering your own personal insights and experiences to each other.

We typically meet once a week in the East Liberty neighborhood of Pittsburgh and adjourn to an appropriate local venue within walking distance based on the turnout, time commitments and weather. For those wanting to check-in before the meeting, we have a conference call Sunday night to let you work on ideas before our meetup Monday morning.

results.description:
Bagels & Bytes is technology-related peer learning and networking at its best! We are the local NTEN Tech Club and Net2 affiliate group in the City of Pittsburgh.

Bring your tech questions, ideas, and issues. Join our fellowship of nonprofit techies (professional and "accidental" are equally welcome) as we brainstorm, share ideas and solutions, and support each other! This group is very supportive and non-judgmental. There is no such thing as a "stupid" question at these meetings — all questions and topics for discussion are welcomed. We learn from each other in unexpected ways constantly, regardless of knowledge or skill levels. Hence, you don't have to be an "expert" techie to attend, just curious and interested in nonprofit technology.

The Allegheny County group meets the first Wednesday of each month (except January and July) from 8:30-10 am. Meeting locations rotate every few months, but the group is always hosted by a local nonprofit org. We typically do a summer "outing" each June (2015 will be Bagels & Bytes & Critters at Animal Rescue League on June 3). We generally hold our December meeting on a Friday afternoon at Dave and Buster's at the Waterfront, our annual "holiday party."

The Westmoreland County group meets the second Tuesday each month, typically at King's Restaurant on Rte. 30 west of Greensburg but the location sometimes varies.

Bagels & Bytes is FREE to attend, but you must RSVP. Please register via phone or email at 412-397-6000 or bcnm@rmu.edu. You may also register online at http://www.rmu.edu/bcnmregistration.

Learn more about upcoming events on our blog: https://bagelsbytesallegheny.wordpress.com/.

Started: 2000

Current organizer: Cindy Leonard
results.name: Bagels & Bytes

results.description:
October 1, 2016 enjoy a day cycling along the Great Allegheny Passage Rails to Trail between West Newton and Pittsburgh’s South Side in support of the American Red Cross. The American Red Cross Ride for the Red Steel Towns Trail Ride is a daylong cycling trip between West Newton and Pittsburgh. Riders can start at either end of the route - in historic West Newton or in Pittsburgh’s Southside - and return to their starting location. Riders can choose their own pace and any distance up to the 64 mile full course.

The Red Cross will provide Terminus starting points at both ends, as well as aid and hydration stations along the trail at 4-6 mile intervals.

The event will host some friendly competition between participants with prizes and trophies or plaques.

Competitive events include:

Team Fundraising Total

Student Team Fundraising Total

Individual Fundraising Total

Student Individual Fundraising Total

There will be a Bar Competition organized by local pubs and restaurants whereby each enters a team and the winner obtains yet to be determined "spoils" from the other competing establishments.

Register as an individual or as a team today at : https://www.crowdrise.com/RidetheSteelTownTrail

For more info place this link in your browser: 

 https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/32941424/Ride%20for%20Red%20Flyer%202016.pdf

If you have never been along this section of the trail you are in for a treat. The Steel Towns Trail Cycling Event takes riders along the GAP Trail alongside the Youghiogheny and Monongahela Rivers, from West Newton through the historic steel towns of Boston, McKeesport, Duquesne, Homestead, The Waterfront and Pittsburgh’s Southside.

The trail, recently completed to Pittsburgh, has a packed, crushed limestone surface for a smooth ride. Built mainly on abandoned rail beds, the trail is nearly level with the average grade of less than 1 percent. The ride between West Newton and Pittsburgh follows the Youghiogheny and Monongahela Rivers and travels through many historic local and reclaimed “Steel City” areas. Along the ride you will enjoy the rivers, historic industrial sights, parks, bike-only river bridges and other interesting cycling sights to make the day enjoyable and interesting while supporting the mission of American Red Cross.

This is both a cycling event and fundraiser. There is a small registration fee, and Riders are asked to solicit donations for their cycling effort in support of the Red Cross . All proceeds from this ride will be donated to American Red Cross Disaster Relief and Military Family Support Services for our local Red Cross Chapters supporting Western Pennsylvania. These two American Red Cross Chapters, The Red Cross of  Chestnut Ridge and The Red Cross of Southwestern Pa are responsible for the support of Allegheny, Westmoreland, Fayette, Indiana, Washington, Green and Armstrong counties.

Your participation will directly assist your neighbors in their time of greatest need.

 All donors will receive a receipt from the ARC for charitable contribution records.

Register today at https://www.crowdrise.com/RidetheSteelTownTrail
results.name: American Red Cross Ride for the Red - Steel Town Trail Ride

results.description:
This group is for anyone who is looking for positive life transformation and personal healing. 

Meditation on Twin Hearts (MTH) was developed and taught by Grandmaster Choa Kok Sui.

It is a easy guided meditation designed to achieve inner stillness, healing and harmony. Simple yet powerful. Short yet deep.

It is practiced regularly all over the world by people from different backgrounds.

No prior meditation experience is required. Anyone with average focus and understanding can meditate and experience inner peace.

Group meditations increases the effect of meditation multifold. 


Benefits of MTH

With regular practice of MTH, one develops a clearer energy body.

Clear energy body means: * clear thinking, * clear perception, * better relationships, * good health, * enhanced healing abilities

Additionally, we become instruments of world service when we share the blessings with Mother Earth.


Pranic Healing

MTH is taught as a part of the Pranic Healing Level 1 course.

Pranic Healing is a powerful and effective ‘no touch’ energy healing modality developed by Grand Master Choa. It uses ‘life force’ or prana to heal physical and emotional ailments on oneself and others.

results.description:
I'm probably not moving to London or the Bay Area. Is it possible to be a professional Haskell programmer in Pittsburgh? Wouldn't it be nice to have a day job slinging Erlang or Elixir?. How about getting paid to hack Clojure? Maybe your dream job is coding Common Lisp or OCaml. Is there anything we can do to promote functional programming in our town? Can we be a little less passive? If there was a visible functional community in the area, could that help to create possibilities?

With the possible exception of the multi-paradigm language Scala, I'm not sure there is a single functional programming language that's in wide enough commercial use here in Pittsburgh to support a significant work force. Likewise, potential employers might be averse to adopting FP for lack of a pool  of such developers from which to draw. But perhaps all functional languages taken together as a whole could provide a suitable foundation. It's a concurrent and polyglot world now and our industry needs what the functional paradigm has to offer.

The hope is that such a community could lower the barriers to adoption of functional languages for both employers and developers in our area.
results.name: Pittsburgh Functional Programming Meetup

results.description:
All of us have a Dream Source within ourselves ready to provide us with timely news and information about our health, our careers, our relationships, the state of our psyche and possible futures before us. By claiming the energy of our dreams, working with the dreams and sharing them with other dreamers in a safe and encouraging space we can make great changes in our lives and find a source of creativity, fun and adventure within ourselves.

The foundation of becoming an awakened dreamer is dream journaling. We'll present basic journaling techniques and how to encourage our Dream Source to send us more dreams. One we have dreams to work with we can share them with others in a safe way that encourages us to take the positive energy of our dreams to make changes in our waking life. We will also cover using dreams as a source of creativity and problem solving, as a path to our own inner spiritual guides and as a fun place for exploration and adventure.

Once we become dreamers who are capturing and working with our dreams we can begin the real adventure. We are not limited to worldly concerns in dreaming and can use our dreams in near-infinite ways to expand our horizons and abilities and to have fun. We can use our dreams as the basis for creative works using the images directly or as the source for writing. We can play in our dream by dialoging with dream characters or performing dream theater in a group, or by reentering our dreams to get more information. The adventures you can have with dreaming are limitless and are only bounded by your imagination. Dreaming is an adventure, dreaming is fun, and dreaming is about soul. Join a group of fellow adventures who desire to dig into these ancient depths!

We are a registered non-profit organization and part of the International MOMS Club organization (http://momsclub.org) that uses Meetup for their website. 

Our MOMS Club typically meet during the day when at-home mothers need the most support. We believe being a stay-at-home mom shouldn't isolate you, so we include our children in our activities.

We offer a variety of  daytime activities throughout the month. Also we offer many groups such as : daytime Playgroups, Book Club, Movie Club, Pokeno, Stork's Club, Helping Hands and Tots' Day Out. We also have evening activities highlighted by our monthly Moms Night Out, This is just for you, the hard working mom!

If you are interested in joining our MOMS Club please request to join us through MeetUp  or send an email to momscranberrynorth@gmail.com. Once we have heard from you our Membership Vice President will send you all the information you will need to join. Our membership dues are only $25 per year, (that is less than a cup of coffee a month!) and is renewed on the month which you joined. After this process, you can join our Meetup website and start participating in our awesome group!

results.description:
About us:
Libertus (latin for "freed man") is a Pittsburgh-based organization devoted to developing the inner strength of men. It is led by Duquesne PCCP graduate and Professional Coach James "J" Stamatelos.

Our Training:
Our training programs are for those who have made their growth a priority.  Our members learn how multiple skills for developing inner strength, including (but not limited to): developing authentic self-confidence, facing fear, gaining emotional intelligence, learning how to respond instead of react, practicing mindfulness, building healthy relationships, and much, much more. Our training programs are not for the timid or weak of heart. They require considerable courage and practice, but promise a high reward for those willing to walk the path. 

Who We're Looking For:
We are looking for men in their 20's and 30's who have made self-development a major priority in their lives. While prior struggles aren't a requirement, over 80% of our current members have already been through therapy or 12-step. They come from backgrounds including depression, anxiety, suicide, traumatic injury, alcohol addiction, drug addiction, and imprisonment. Overcoming these situations has given our members the strength needed to go within and answer questions many spend their entire lives avoiding. We capitalize on this strength and use it in a powerful team-based environment that inspires all members to bring out the best from both themselves and all those around them.
results.name: Libertus Inner Strength Training for Men

results.description:
Shut Up & Write! Meetup is a venue for writers to work in the company of other writers on a regular basis. Writing, whether approached as a profession or as an avocation, is an isolating activity. We provide this forum, writing resources and meeting times as a method of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about ‘writing down the bones’ and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

Meetup Format
Making the time to write one hour per week is an empowering and ultimately rewarding experience but it needs to serve as the foundation of your daily discipline. If you RSVP that you are coming, then please arrive 10-15 minutes before the start of the Meetup. The facilitator will lead introductions and then the group will write for an hour. There will then be 15-30 minutes of social time to get to know each other and possibly discuss personal writing successes such as getting published or overcoming writing resistance in some small way. No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Writing is the only thing that, when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.
Gloria Steinem
results.name: Shut Up & Write! Pittsburgh

results.description:
Welcome to the social group for those that live in the western suburbs of Pittsburgh. This is a group for professionals ages 30-45 who are looking to make new friends & socialize and don't always have time to make it into the city.

Meet new people and make lasting friendships while joining us for brunch, lunch, dinner, movies, live entertainment, outdoor activities, and much more! If you would like to plan events, please let me know and I will be happy to add you as a planner.

VOLUNTARY DONATIONS: It's FREE for you to join, as I don't charge any annual dues. However, Meetup.com charges me as the organizer $180 a year to host this meetup. If you love the events after a few months of being a member, please consider making a small donation to help defray this annual cost. There's a "Chip in" link on the site.

To join the group, we ask a few things:

1) Have a profile picture that is a clear shot of your face. This will help find you at events. The event planner usually posts where we are at the venue, so make sure to look for them too!

2) Answer the profile questions completely. This helps the members get to know each other and can give event planners ideas for events.

3) In respect to those who take the time to organize an event, please RSVP 'yes' if you plan to attend. If your plans change, you are required to change your RSVP to 'no'. After 2 no-shows, you will be removed from the group. Anyone making members feel uncomfortable will be removed from the group.

4) If you have not logged onto our page in 6 months or longer, you will be removed from the group. If you find this has happened, just resubmit a request to join and you can be added again.

Thank you and we look forward to meeting you at an event soon!

results.description:
The Unitarian Universalists (UUs) of Greater Pittsburgh is made up of 11 UU congregations and over 1100 UUs in and around Pittsburgh. To learn more about us, visit http://uupittsburgh.org or https://www.facebook.com/groups/UUPittsburgh/.

Unitarian Universalism is a theologically diverse religion that encourages people to seek their own spiritual paths. You'll find people from all kinds of backgrounds, representing many faith traditions, and on all kinds of spiritual journeys, in our congregations. We like to be in community, are committed to social justice and action as individuals and congregations, and rely on covenants not creeds to bind us together. All of our local churches are welcoming and inclusive of LGBTQ people and families. You can be yourself here, and be loved, unconditionally. A good place to begin learning about Unitarian Universalism is to start with what we believe and our principles: http://www.uua.org/beliefs/what-we-believe.

But you absolutely don't need to be a UU to hang out with us! We like to connect, learn, grow, and have fun along the way. We'll post programs and events here on Meetup that we think will be of interest to the broader community, and especially to seekers. We invite you to visit one of our churches on Sunday morning or come out for one of our events listed on Meetup! As the group grows maybe we can try some Meetup-only get togethers just to meet and chat if that sounds like something you'd like to do.

Finally, Rev. Robin and Mark will be around to post, answer questions, or just kibbitz if you want to say hi.
results.name: Unitarian Universalists of Greater Pittsburgh
