results.description: Dedicated to helping badminton players in the Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (U.S.A) area meetup at suitable courts for more formal pre-arranged doubles or singles matches, or informal pick-up open group badminton court times. This group is intended for an information exchange for all levels of badminton player, from casual/recreational to competitive, from casual pickup to serious tournament players. Never played badminton indoors? Does badminton strike you as not athletically strenuous enough? Come, try badminton with actual lines on a suitable gym floor surface, and be prepared to sweat! Competitive badminton matches arguably involve as much speed and strategy as tennis matches, and a light difference in stroke can just as easily make the difference between in or out. Badminton players must react to their opponent's move more frequently than tennis because it takes far less time for a smashed birdie to fly from one end of the court to the other, being a smaller court and a more aerodynamic object. Badminton players can startle one another by changing the direction of play as suddenly as table tennis players except in badminton the opportunities to impart any meaningful degree of spin to the bird (except to a slight degree on a certain type of rare serve ) are almost non-existent and because the drag on the bird increases as the bird slows, there is a wider array of (velocity-dependent) trajectories available for attacking. With a light touch and clever decision-making, a less agile player with quick reactions and hand-eye coordination can often defeat a player in much better physical condition -- better play-making leads to less strenuous play, especially in doubles. These are some of the reasons that professional badminton is played in front of crowds of thousands in several European and Asian countries -- it is a fantastic sport and a very good workout for both mind and body. This Meetup is a place for individual players and established badminton groups throughout greater Pittsburgh to organize, exchange info, and potentially organize our region's badminton enthusiasts to exchange info with similar groups in other regions, potentially for inter-regional tournaments. My name is Isaak Berg, and I have enjoyed playing badminton regularly with a group who meets at the Hampton Community Center for the past few months. I learned to play competitively in high school and then for a few years while playing other sports. When you join, please let the group know about your interest or experience level in badminton, whether you are interested in joining a group, your age range, and the location, days or times you usually play or are hoping to play.

Please introduce yourself to the members of the Meetup group and feel free to reach out to Dan, one of the local organizers about getting involved and/or for more information on upcoming events. 


OFFERINGS BY PSYCHONAUT CO-FOUNDERS

Join Electric Jesus author & Bioenergetic Healer Jonathan Talat Phillips for advanced shamanaut tools and quantum energy techniques that manifest your wildest “F— Yeah!” desires and dreams. Jedi healing & training, psychonaut journeying.  Medical cannabis sessions available.  www.psychonaut-talat.com


ROCK & ROLL RENAISSANCE 

Rock-n-Roll career witch Claudia Wheeler-Rappe will help you tap into your own creative superpowers, so you can choose what your dream career looks and feels like. THE PSYCHONAUT HOTEL:   BED & BREAKFAST at SPACE CAMP

Topanga Canyon, LA.  Psychonaut Sessions can be included

If you like to play in Southern California, we invite you to visit us at our home, community hub, and media headquarters in beautiful Topanga Canyon, just minutes outside of Los Angeles. Stays include Claudia's ecstatic cooking and Talat's shamanaut sessions.  Hot tub, nature hikes, 15-min drive from the beach. Dan, Claudia & Talat

results.description:
The initial group founded to understand, improve, and educate others about PittMesh: Pittsburgh's Community Wireless 

Who should join: Anyone with a technical or community organizing background. This group is primarily for the technical advancement of the PittMesh network which runs on OpenWRT, an open-source, Linux-based embedded system and servers hosting services on the network. Application development and documentation will be the most focused on activities in this group. Excellent communication skills are a must as well as an enthusiasm for working on networking and development projects in small groups.

Why should members join: To be a part of the design and implementation of the PittMesh Standard, a standard package/build for OpenWRT routers. Also, to learn about topics related to classic networking, wireless networking, wireless and open-network security, and community engagement through application development. Each meeting should have a presentation of a related topic to excite and inspire the PWG members and to encourage the adoption or refinement of technologies, both new and old, for the betterment of the PittMesh Community Wireless Network.


* What can members expect out of the group: Primarily collaborative work with other PWG members to build and test technologies for the PittMesh network. Each meeting will have one presenter briefly digging into the details of an important or novel aspect or use of the Pittmesh network to ensure all members have an increasingly synchronized body of knowledge upon which advancements can be made and new uses can be found.


* Community: Meetups will facilitate interaction between members from all over the Pittsburgh area by giving an interface through which ideas can be exchanged and work can be accomplished. The PWG will meet in person and remotely via mailing lists and chat.
results.name: PittMesh Working Group

results.description:
In Gear Pittsburgh is a cycling group with a twist. The philosophy behind the group is to have fun, enjoy the world around us, improve as individuals, learn, share your knowledge and help others.

When Bill and I started weekly rides on the Northside two years ago, the idea was to introduce people to cycling and encourage them to get out and about. We wanted to make everyone feel welcomed and included. Since then, the weekly rides have grown into a large friendly group of people. Some of them were completely new to cycling when they joined. Others were seasoned warriors on two wheels. We got along and supported each other. Good friendships were forged. Great times were had. We felt that this group - In Gear Pittsburgh - would be a logical continuation of the tradition that was started on the Wednesday rides.

The group is primarily about cycling. This includes all types of cycling - road, trail, touring, MTB etc. It also includes all levels of difficulty. We will continue our beginner level Wednesday rides but members are welcome to set up more challenging rides. All we ask for is to clearly indicate the level of difficulty in the ride description.

Here comes the twist. In addition to cycling, we would like to include other activities, especially in the winter time. Some examples of events include:
Hiking
City walks
Bowling
Ice skating
Movie nights
Book discussion clubs
Live music events
Community oriented projects such as trail cleanup and community gardening
Bicycle maintenance workshops
Cooking demonstrations
Arts and crafts workshops

The list is not exhaustive. If you have an idea in mind - all you have to do is suggest it.

We would like to keep this group a friendly place. We don't believe in setting rules for the sake of rules, and the rules will be minimal. The idea is to relax and have fun while respecting others. Leave your personal drama and negativity behind and think positive. The group is open to all members regardless of their age, gender, race, religion, sexual orientation, political affiliation etc. Discriminatory behavior, defamatory remarks or any form of aggression towards other members will not be tolerated.

Thank you for joining and lets have fun!
results.name: In Gear Pittsburgh

results.description:
Do you have a son or daughter between the ages of 7-13 who has been diagnosed with high functioning autism or Aspergers? Do they have a difficult time socially meeting and making friends? Are you a parent of a special needs child feeling alone, overwhelmed and wishing you had a support system?" Are you and/or your child frustrated about not being accepted by their peers, sitting alone at lunch, being bullied or picked on by other children? Perhaps your child doesn't know how to make friends or doesn't feel that they can relate to others. If this sounds familiar, then you and your child are not alone. I am wanting to start this group to help bring parents and their child/children together that are in need of meeting others on their social, interest level, etc. If you are interested in coming together in a safe, friendly, accepting environment with others going through a similar situation, please reply with a description of your child's social issues, diagnosis, age, interests, and general location. We live in the Dormont area and welcome folks from neighboring areas. I will be in touch with you shortly with more information.
Thank You
results.name: Pittsburgh parents of high functioning autistic children

results.description:
Welcome!


Thanks for stopping by. BRown Empowered Women (BR.E.W.) is a group of women working hard to live up to our full potential. However, we realize that that journey is made easier by a group of supportive women in your corner. This group will help to serve as that corner.


My name is Sonya Majors. I am the organizer of this group. We are in our infancy stage, so things will be changing and evolving as time goes on. My vision is to create a network of women of color to help support and challenge each other. A no drama sounding board, where you can market your product or service, get advice, vent or just share a few laughs. I hope we will all grow in our own career and business endeavors as well as enjoy the company of other like minded women of color. Work hard. Play hard.


While membership is open to all, the concentration of the group will be around the challenges that women of color face and African American culture. Partially because that is my upbringing; that is what I know best. That being said, the principles that should drive us are universal. The desire to succeed, excel, help others, enjoy life, and reach our full potential is simply finding your purpose.


At some point, I will revise this statement and share more of my thoughts and wishes for this group, but for now.....Welcome, so glad you came by. 😉


Thanks

Sonya
results.name: BRown Empowered Women - BREW

results.description:
Ready to fall in love? To have the crazy, sexy, passionate relationship you’ve always fantasized about? You’ve joined the right group.

Since you’re here, I can only figure that putting yourself out there isn’t the challenge.

Do you keep attracting the same relationship, only with a different person?

Or maybe you go on a lot of lackluster dates?

Or have trouble getting past date number one?

I get it. Trust me, I’ve been there. This group exists to shift that paradigm, and to have fun while doing it!

So what are we going to do together?

We’re going to connect.

We’re going to travel.

We’re going to grow.

We’re going to get uncomfortable.

We’re going to stretch ourselves and be comforted that everyone else is also out of their comfort zones.

Most importantly we’re going to have fun and meet interesting people, who’s intentions are a little deeper than finding their next date.

Thank you so much for being willing to allow me in on your journey, and I can’t wait to meet you!

~ Danita

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in tapering and weaning off of alcohol safely, [stopping cold turkey can be dangerous to your health] and reduce excessive consumption and binges. Admitting you need and desire help. An alternative to rehab and or AA. Based off the website; hamsnetwork.org., the books, "The easy way to stop drinking" by Allen Car and "The 30 day sobriety solution" by Jack Canfield and Dave Andrews. I started this group to help myself and others in a supportive collaboration of ideas, discussions, encouragement and hope for a great future. Stopping or reducing alcohol ALONE without support, meetings, texts, emails, calls and an accountability partner makes it very difficult to succeed. We truly need each other. We must admit and believe alcohol destroys our future, and that we must either reduce our consumption or completely stop.[excess alcohol destroys] For those of you who are completely sober, feel free to join us, however please realize that everyone's path to reducing or choosing to become totally sober is different. AA, rehab and quitting cold turkey aren't the only answer. We will not label each other Alcoholics in our meetings. Each person who joins this group is expected to encourage each other with positivity without labels and judgment and without pushing rehab or AA.  People who want to reduce there consumption or stop drinking completely, need to hear and believe that they can and will succeed.

Join us and let's succeed together, isolation is not the answer.
results.name: Tapering Off Alcohol or Reducing Consumption Meetup Group

results.description:
This group is for small business owners including artists, musicians, and startups interested in learning the best digital marketing strategies for small businesses looking to get found online (particularly mobile smart phone users), grow their customer base (mailing list, crm, and email marketing) and customer conversion strategies. 

I started this group because I often see awesome, unique, independent Mom and Pop businesses lose to larger chains with substantially larger budgets and frequently inferior products and services. Meetings are open to anything related to how to use digital marketing and technology to get a bigger bang for your marketing dollar.  

We'll discuss website (when to use wordpress versus cheaper "cookie cutter" solutions, business directory tactics, search engine optimization (SEO), local search, search engine marketing (SEM - Facebook advertising and Google Ad words), customer relationship marketing (CRM), building a customer database, email marketing, video marketing, content strategy, App Development, and more. What did I miss ;-). I have experience with most of this but by no means am I an expert.  Let's discuss time effective, authentic and best practices to help small businesses WIN through local search and conversion strategies.  

Feel free to email me at george@rockonmarketingproductions.com or through meetup with ideas about how

Entrepreneurship permeates the culture of Silicon Valley - the innovation capital of the world.

topics.name: Family and friends of disabled individuals
Be the Change You Wish to See in the World

results.description:
Access Mob Pittsburgh promotes social advancement through positive change.


The Americans with Disabilities Act is a complaint-driven law that requires individuals with disabilities to sue businesses in order to be granted basic civil rights and gives the public a negative image of people with visible differences. The goals of the Access Mob are to bring communities together to advocate for change through positive measures.


In the spirit of Flash Mobs, this is a space for discussion and organization of Accessibility Mobs. Accessibility Mobs can be (but are not limited to) any one of the following:


* Organizing groups to canvass neighbourhoods to do censuses of sidewalks, intersections, and cut curbs in residential areas and business districts.


* Organizing groups to canvass business and retail areas to evaluate the level of accessibility individual businesses according to ADA and ABA standards.


* Ramp Crawls, Shopping Crawls, and related activities to reward businesses who are ADA compliant, to show the collective buying power or people with disabilities, and to demonstrate to a range of businesses that yes, people who are disabled like going out to night clubs and fancy restaurants.


* "Un-Protests" - Approaching businesses that are not accessible and expressing to them that people with disabilities want to spend money there, and that people who are currently fully-abled want to continue patronizing should they become disabled in the future.
results.name: Access Mob Pittsburgh

results.description:
This is a workshop group dedicated to fashion, glamour and editorial photography of professional models. 

There will be onsite help for photographers to improve their skills and experiment with your equipment or mine. Photographers are encouraged to bring or share their latest work and get assistance on improving photography and post work. 

These workshops will vary from 1 on 1 to small groups in Pittsburgh and Western PA areas. Occasionally we will use a studio or host location but primarily these will be on locations to keep things off a studio background. 

Models will be professionally trained and prepared for the workshops. Professional quality hair and makeup will be supported. Models will be over the age of 18 or have a parent onsite during photoshoots. Noncommercial photo releases will be provided and commercial releases will be negotiated directly with the models. 

I am an editorial fashion photographer and have been full time working with publications, advertising and marketing companies with hundreds of publications since 2008. I'm currently serving as the director of photography for Living Magazine, formerly the DoP for ModelEMI and Elon Fashion Magazines.

I have been conducting workshops on Meetup for about 5 years.  Since moving from Mississippi to Pennsylvania I was yet to have one here and it was about time to kick it back off again with high end models.
results.name: Pittsburgh Modeling Photography Group

results.description: Are you in alcohol recovery (or would like to be) and need an "extra" layer of support or encouragement? Do you work in the Southpointe Industrial Park and are sick of eating lunch all by yourself? Would you rather have lunch with a few men with whom you can share your struggles and successes? This may be the group for you. The purpose of this group is to provide an opportunity for men who desire to remain sober a chance to meet similar men and talk over lunch. This is an informal meet-up group, without agenda, and the conversation consists of what you decide to discuss. Each week, we will gather at one of Southpointe's restaurants for lunch from 12:00 to 1:00. My hope is that in time, you and I will develop friendships and accountability partners that will help to positively influence our decision to quit alcohol. League Rules: * Common decency prevails. Anonymity is not a requirement, however, there is an expectation of confidentiality (what is said at lunch...stays at lunch). This group is meant to be a supplement to your abstinence program and not a replacement for one. I look forward to meeting you! Todd
results.name: League of Sober Gentlemen

We welcome connection and the honest expression of emotions. How we feel is precious and everyone's experience is sacred. We are here to remind each other that all humans are one family and that when we come together to create, we have immense power. When we collaborate we do more than survive, we thrive! We live in abundance! Each person has unique gifts and we support each other in exploring our gifts and actualizing our dreams. If you need a massage or a hug, come on over! Our community has many sweethearts and healers who would be more than willing to lend you a hand :) If you want to have a heart-to-heart with someone or brainstorm ideas with another, come check out our parties! We host a diversity of events: Potlucks, Drum circles, Sacred ceremony, Gift sharing circle, Love mob, Massage party, and whatever the flow brings! Love is the source of life and our intention is to share the love that is inside all of us. “If you could only sense how important you are to the lives of those you meet; how important you can be to the people you may never even dream of. There is something of yourself that you leave at every meeting with another person.” -Fred Rogers

results.description:
This is a Meetup Group for men and women who are 40+ and work, live, or socialize west of Pittsburgh.  Are you tired of driving to the City of Pittsburgh and beyond for Meetups?  Perhaps you are looking to meet new friends who live locally?  We will plan events in the West Hills, Airport Area, Robinson Township, Sewickley, and Southern Beaver County.  We welcome your suggestions for social events such as happy hours, dinners, festivals, fundraisers, recreation, and more. 

Please note that:  

• We will occasionally cross-post events from other Meetup Groups.

• We will take "passport trips" to events outside of the Pittsburgh West area, but primarily events will be centered in the Western suburbs.

• Please be courteous and update your RSVP if you do not plan to attend so that we are  not waiting for you to arrive.  If you RSVP, you are expected to attend.  Meetup is NOT the internet.  They are real events, where real people meet in person.

• STRICT DINNER POLICY - IF YOU RSVP FOR A DINNER, YOU MUST ENSURE YOUR RSVP IS ACCURATE BY NOON THE DAY BEFORE THE EVENT.  ATTENDEES WILL RECEIVE AN EMAIL REMINDING THEM OF THIS POLICY AND ASK THEM TO CONFIRM THEIR ATTENDANCE TWO DAYS PRIOR TO THE DINNER.  No-shows for dinners are not tolerated because reservations must be made and adhered to.  The restaurant has set up tables and possibly has added staff to serve us.  Attendance is tracked.  Repeat no-shows are not acceptable and those members will be removed from the group.  In order for us to continue to schedule dinners, everyone must be responsible in maintaining the RSVP's current.

• SPAM AND SALES EMAILS ARE NOT PERMITTED.  If anyone gets spammed or sales solicitations, please let the organizers know.  

• THIS IS NOT A DATING OR SINGLES GROUP.  It is intended to meet and socialize with others in the area.  There are plenty of dating sites and singles Meetup groups if that is your main interest.

• Suggestions are welcome – use the Discussions tab or email the organizers.

• There is no charge to join this group, however, donations (online or in-person) are welcome to cover the costs of the website, nametags, markers, etc! 

• Candid feedback is encouraged (whining is not!).
results.name: Pittsburgh West 40+ Socializers

topics.name: PTSD, Disability and Women Veteran Issues

results.description: "This is a group for women veterans and those who support women veterans in overcoming the unique post military life readjustment/reintergration challenges they face. Women veterans are courageous, heroic, talented, intelligent skilled leaders, who have selflessly sacraficed themselves in defense of this country. Upon reentering civilian life the accomplishments, contributions, and service of women veterans goes unrecognized. We are faced with PTSD, MST, high unemployment, health care issues, isolation, homelessness, financial and social issues, and there is no organization in the Pittsburgh, PA area that brings us together to address our specfic needs. Separated we are silent, voiceless, I ask that you please join me in helping us to help ourselves, and in ensuring that we have access and opportunity to enjoy the way of life we stood to defend."
results.name: Pittsburgh Women Veterans Meetup (Women Warriors United)

results.description:
In this group we explore Tantra in Buddhist, Hindu, neo traditions as well as practices considered tantric rather than Tantra. 

There are many forms of this body of work and experience called Tantra. Elitism or pushing one specific type will not be tolerated.

Tantra is the practice of alchemy, of weaving all parts of life, emotions, and feelings into one tapestry. The goal is liberation, freedom in each moment. It is as much about the soft as the sharp. Being here means you are an active presence for yourself and speaking with clarity from your experience.

Group meetups include movie nights, workshops on topics of interest, authentic relating game nights, hosting teachers, open forum, meditation and yoga, and more. We seek and explore authentic relating and connection while remaining free and liberated. 

Some of us are sensualists and some are in need of healing sexual wounds. 

This group is about being seen and truly seeing another in all our glorious humanness and as such approval and acceptance are key ingredients that we work with.

On deeper levels we explore siddhis, yogic science, magic, manifestation, and more using Tantric principles.

This is a SAFE space. Remain open and humble that each persons experience is perfect for them. Rather than offering unsolicited advice, support others with your personal experience, strength, and hope. Any rude nastiness will be removed.
results.name: Pittsburgh Tantra

results.description: Welcome to Dispelling Shame! If you're looking for something that will be deep, insightful, and will transform your Christian life you have come to the right place. We're a group of women that meet on the fourth Saturday monthly at Allison Park Church 2326 Duncan Ave, Allison Park, PA 15101 starting at 10 am. We provide an environment of safety where women can honestly communicate and support one another with empathy. We bring to light the conflicting competing expectations we face as women and Christians. We worship, share, laugh, cry and pray together. The lies we believe seem to be dispelled in this honest and vulnerable setting where the Holy Spirit has the freedom to move easily and powerfully. Come join us as we courageously explore the blockages that limit us from living the abundant life promised to His daughters. Follow us on Facebook , check out our website dispellingshame.com or email us at dispellingshame@gmail.com

results.description:
The Pittsburgh Change Ringing guild is the one and only place in Pittsburgh to learn the old English tradition of Change Ringing on Church tower bells. Our set of 8 bells range from 496 Lbs to 960 Lbs in weight and and are controlled manually by ringers in a room below the bells using only ropes!

Change ringing is a 400 year old tradition of bell ringing that started in England, which is still home to 5,000 towers. It was imported to colonial America, the first tower here being the famous Old North Church in Boston, where one of the original ringers was Paul Revere. Bells weighing hundreds or thousands of pounds are swung through 360 degrees several dozen feet above the ringers, using just ropes and skill to produce cascades of sound according to centuries old patterns.

Although tower bells are quite heavy, they are precisely balances and therefore can be rung by young and old alike.  Ringing is moderately intensive exercise, especially for the upper body, and does require, to some degree, a certain sense of rhythm.  Beyond this, qualifications are few.  One need not be big, strong, musical, or mathematical to ring. Nor does one need to belong to Southminser Church in order to ring.  

We encourage anyone interested in learning to ring to contact the Pittsburgh Change Ringing Guild.

Check out a couple videos below to see the bells and ringers in action before making your first visit to the tower!

Bells swinging: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=liuRptmR088
Ringers pulling ropes: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M1vSfNF7OfI

Learn more about the art of Change Ringing here: http://www.nagcr.org/pamphlet.html
results.name: Pittsburgh Change Ringing Guild

results.description:
Howdy! 

I set this group up for anyone interested in running & training with a group and still HAVING Fun!   I'm training for the Pittsburgh half marathon and I believe that training for a half marathon or full doesn't have to be hard! 

I would say I have love & hate relationship with running but that fuels the passion to run a faster race and to have more fun doing it.  I also thought that we would try to set up a weekly group run, this could be a meetup for finding a couple of people to run (even last minute) because running is more fun when you're running with friends. 

So if it's Monday at 4, and you want to do a run at North Park, cool, post it and people can respond.  Tues night at 9 pm and you're stressed out and want to do a run at 5:30 am the next morning?  Cool, I mean no, not cool, are you nuts?  5:30am?  You're probably flying solo on this one.  ;-)    Just teasing, you all get the idea. 

Because larger group runs are fun to.  Organizing one weekly run which to start is Saturday at 3:00pm  we'll introduce ourselves and wait for anyone who might get lost and then do a 3 - 5 mile run to the casinos and back. Grab a beer, coffee after if people are up for it.  Anything goes. 

To start, because it's an easy run to manage for different distances and speeds, meeting in the parking lot across from the Heinz Lofts cafe.  ( orginally set up the group up for the park in Millvate near the river).  If you never run a race before and you want group motivation to run your first 5k, awesome! if you are looking for the Boston qualifying time for next year's marathon.  Awesome, but we probably won't be fast enough for you unless you're doing a slower run that day.  One more thing, when you get a chance can you answer a couple of questions goals for this group, do you prefer group runs or finding people to run with, and what kind of pace you planning on running at.  Also, let me know if you're a beginner and just signed up for your first 5k.  Love to have you in this group.  You all have no excuses except for I guess tomorrow since there is a Penguin's game.  Ahh, bad luck but I'll be there even if I'm running solo. 

email, text, kik, whatsapp or message me here.  Here is your running inspirational quote or photo of the week.  Feel free to post any of this stuff as well.
results.name: Pittsburgh Race training while being healthy & having fun!

results.description: I unexpectedly became a father at age 60 with my first biological child. He is now 20 months old and is beginning to show his true colors. I also have an adopted son, who I adopted at age 16 ten years ago. As a foster parent, I felt alone and very isolated. Developing one's parenting skills as a single father is not easy, and there's no magic manual that comes with your child. I would like to start a support group that helps single fathers know that they are not alone and con receive support through one another! Many times I feel alone and clueless with my adopted son, who I cannot get to grow up and to move out of the house. This invitation is extended to all single fathers who are divorced, never married, foster, new and expectant fathers. Race, color, national origin or religion are not an issue. We can meet at my home or a public place and share one another's personal concerns, worries, fears, joys and good times including "i've been there!" experiences. Please contact me at mrpea@me.com if interested. Looking forward to meeting and sharing with you. Thomas Preston
results.name: Pittsburgh single Dads support Meetup

Repeat the same process the next week on  the sole of each foot, and use the hair brush on the back on each leg scraping it up behind the leg.  for a week...


Feet and Sensations Working on the undersides of the feet can cause very strong energy-movement sensations indeed. These can be extremely uncomfortable, even painful, especially in the very early stages of these development exercises. 

 Intense buzzing, tingling, tickling, and bone-deep vibrating energy-movement sensations are commonly felt. These may continue for some time, even after the awareness actions that caused them have been discontinued. This will sometimes be accompanied by nervous twitching and muscular spasming in the feet and legs. This can also be quite strong in the early stages.  

All these sensations are normal for this type of energetic development work. The degree of sensations felt indicates the degree of resistance to the energy being raised. Strong energy-movement sensations are caused by larger-than-normal amounts of energy being forced through narrowed energy pathways and conduits. This over-stimulates the nerves in the skin and surrounding tissue near the affected energy pathways.

 Energy Bounce Techniques 
Energy bounce is a simple and effective awareness technique that helps to clear, redefine, and strengthen all energy pathways

What you do is ....You are  taking  awareness of the feeling from the itchy -tingling sensation from the brushing methods or the index finger circling method  ...Taking that feeling making into an awareness and thinking it through one or both legs, from feet to hips. then bounce repeatedly from feet to hips. You will quickly develop a natural rhythm and will feel the slight dragging effect it has in your energy body. Energy-movement sensations in the bounce area are usually quite mild.

Continue bouncing for at least a minute, or for as long as you wish. It's quite a pleasant sensation when you get used to it and the bounce action quickly becomes almost automatic. Try splitting awareness and bouncing through- both legs at the same time.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Full-Body Bounce

The full-body bounce takes awareness up and down through the entire body. This can be done from any position...I do this daily all day long for the last 43 yrs 

Take awareness from both feet, up through legs, torso, head, and arms, all the way to just above fingertips. Bounce awareness back and forth, from feet to fingertips. The bounce rhythm should be fairly quick, about one or two seconds each way, but whatever feels most natural is best. Try to feel the whole of your body, inside and out, with each full-body bounce.

A variation of the above is with arms resting at your sides, where awareness is bounced from your feet to just above the top of your head. This is far more practical when sitting or standing. 

Keep in mind, after working so laboriously and painstakingly through your newly discovered energy body, that this is only the early training part. The NEW system is very progressive and, once you learn it, large parts of your energy body will quickly begin responding to single awareness actions. The smaller parts of the stimulation exercises given so far quickly combine into larger and simpler whole-of-limb stimulation and energy-raising actions.

Everything starts getting easier, faster, and more effective once this happens.

results.description:
Come join us each Monday as Gaye Fifer, MEd teaches waltz (which is similar to ballroom) to beginners. Gaye has been teaching dance for many years and is also a caller at Pittsburgh Contra. These classes are special because Gaye focuses on the art of communication in dance. For every move, she covers how to lead each move and how to follow it at a leisurely pace. As you learn to give and read cues wordlessly, Gaye goes over how to gauge your partner's comfort level with more advanced moves. 

You switch partners many times each class. This way, you learn to communicate with a variety of partners. With what you learn here, you would be well prepared to dance at any wedding or other formal event. You are also welcomed to attend monthly open waltzes that are well attended by all ages at another location.

We are limiting the number of dancers to 20, so don't miss out. Your first session is free. After that, the series is $70 or $50 for those under 30. You can start week 1 or 2. No partner is required.   

Call Gaye 412-860-7845 for more info.

results.description:
Getting Things Done Pittsburgh (GTD PGH) Productivity Group is a community of local personal productivity enthusiasts who enjoy discussing and sharing ideas/resources centering on David Allen's work, started with his well-regarded book on personal productivity, Getting Things Done®, in and around the Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania metropolitan area. It's that simple!

We do this by... 

1) discussing components of the Getting Things Done methodology at the group meetups;
2) discussing, publishing and publicizing new GTD concepts/products of David Allen & Co. (as well as others) that improve upon members' GTD implementations;
3) inviting members (those new and old to GTD) to the group to share their background with GTD, challenges they are currently facing, and information and resource collaboration; and,
4) providing an online platform to connect outside of our monthly meetups about your ideas, challenges, SUCCESSES, and more with GTD. 

Once a quarter (and sometimes more often) we host seminars and workshops by GTD experts to teach Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced level material to members interested in growing in their GTD practice. 

Who should join?

If you have ever thought, "I could be more productive." Or, "I need to stop procrastinating on major goals in my life." Or, "Where did all this clutter come from?" you're a good candidate for this Meetup. If you have read David Allen's materials, or even tried to implement GTD into your life, work or personal, join us. If you are a GTD black belt ninja and would like to share your GTD skills and knowledge with others. Well, this is the Meetup for you too!

When do we meet? 

Our meetups are posted on the meetup site as scheduled, so check the main page often to see when they're announced!

If you have any questions, please message Ray Sidney-Smith, the Founder/Meetup Organizer. 


Note: GTD® and Getting Things Done® are registered trademarks of the David Allen Company. This group is not affiliated with or officially endorsed by the David Allen Company.
results.name: Getting Things Done Pittsburgh Productivity Group

results.description: I have had a lot of success with doing high intensity, short rest time work outs. I'm looking for others to share ideas with and also workout. We can go to local parks when the weather is better. Right now I usually hole up at LA Fitness in the class room when it is free. I'll give you some examples: Cardio (steps, running in place, jumping rope, sprints) 30 seconds short rest Chest (standard, wide, feet elevated, with a twist, dips) 30 seconds short rest Legs (squats, lunges, and variations with medicine balls) short rest abs (planks, side planks, full body crunch etc.) Squats (and variations) 30 seconds short rest You would then repeat that 3 times. Then take a 1-2 minute rest. That would be one circuit then start over again. You would try to do as many circuits as you could up to 3-5. I do other variations of this when I have gym equipment: Max Rep Pull ups (or assisted) Max Rep Dips (or assisted) 30 seconds Mountain Climbers Max Rep Squats Max Rep Chest Press Max Rep Shoulder Press 30 Seconds Cardio 30 seconds abs Max dips or curls Max Rep kettlebell swings Max Rep Lunges 30 Seconds abs Max Rep Deadlifts Max Hold Wall Sit Max Rep Burpees That would be one circuit. Then you repeat as many times as you can. I usually do 2-3 depending on how much time I have. I'm no personal trainer or anything but someone who is having good results with these types of workouts. It would even be cool to do them in the park in the summer and add sprints and maybe find pull up bars. Anyway, looking for others to get creative with doing some of these.
results.name: Pittsburgh High Intensity Workout Group

results.description: A SPECIAL INVITE FOR VICTIMS: Do you feel captive to past or present sexual abuse? Are haunting memories making it difficult to move on with your life? Do you believe that there is nothing you can do to change your circumstances? She is not only an International Award Winning Speaker - she is a Survivor and Conqueror of childhood sexual abuse! Kelly will share with you how she finally overcame the ramifications and became “TOTALLY SET FREE”, successful and happy. This interactive and inspirational workshop will provide participants with guidance on how become the same. Participants will also receive a workbook containing these guiding principles.

results.description: Welcome! This particular group is for all heterosexual people who are looking to date. Are you recently divorced or 20 years out of a divorce? Are you widowed and thinking you want to get back out there? Are you single and starting over? THIS is the place to be...this introduction just might be a new chapter for you. We have either heard it all or been there....meeting the wrong people, the wrong types, online, offline...the list goes on. We have often heard not enough men at an event.....not enough women at an event.....people want to be text friends only....this group wants to change that and the way people think. A common complaint is that when meeting online...pictures are 20 years old and the person was nothing like the profile. I will ask for a picture and a few short questions so that we get to know everyone better and here is the best part---you WILL get to meet in a group setting and judge for yourselves. That first introduction is KEY. There will never be a charge for this group. I want you to be able to come and go and sign up for events as you see fit. I encourage anyone in or out of the area to join us because you just never know when the right opportunity knocks...and just think...what if you were not there to answer the door? LOL---(someone else is dating your perfect match) LOL.....Remember God put eyes on our face instead of the back of our head so we will always look forward and not back. I do have a few ground rules. 1. No players--this is not a game and you are no longer 24. 2. No clowns---this is not a circus. 3. No stalking---when someone tells you that they are not interested.... Believe them. Issues such as the above mentioned will not be tolerated. Just ask my friends in Meetup. You will be deleted from the group. I think that this could be a great way to get out there and just put it on the table and openly say that you are interested in dating. Please be single, divorced or widowed and if you are not----someone will tell ---Guaranteed ---so please be HONEST! Join us and just have FUN!!! Be open to this and receive it! You just may shock yourself. : )  This group will start out at Panera in the Conference Room to meet and greet and then we will move on for a drink or two and a local venue.

results.description: Pittsburgh area Network Programmability User's Group (NPUG) The world of networking is changing quickly - software defined networking, API's, Python, open source, automation, and other technologies are being introduced and it's clear there's a new skill set required with the next wave of technology. It seems like too much to comprehend, but how does someone get started? The Network Programmability User's Group is a community built around learning and sharing, helps people in different roles like software engineering, network engineering, security management, consulting, architecture, and more start becoming acquainted with new technology. As well, network with your peers and discover new career options. Are interested in learning Python? Want to automate routers, switches and virtual machine configuration? Curious what DevOps is about and how you can get involved? Don't want to be left behind? You're in the right place. The next generation network engineer doesn't need to be a programmer, and the next wave of developers doesn't need to be network engineers, but having some knowledge or skills from both sides is extremely valuable.

This group is set up for Storytivists (authors, potential authors, passionate community members & activists) to meet collectively in person to inform each other's ideas, potential stories, communities to engage and any story related topics.

Storyburgh is a community storytelling platform in Pittsburgh who 1) engages local community and mission driven organizations, 2) focuses on under-reported & under-told stories and 3) shifts the ways stories are gathered, curated and utilized. You can find us online at http://www.storyburgh.org/

results.description:
To call this group fledgling would be an understatement. I decided to start a Facebook group and a Meetup group in March 2016 when I had trouble finding a support network focused on neurodiversity in the Pittsburgh area. I hope this can be a place where people share thoughts, information, advice and other resources that support the Neurodiversity Movement.

Although I have long belonged to a neurodiversity family, I did not actively look for support until a family member was diagnosed as being on the spectrum less than a year ago. I am an all-around novice. If there are other groups in the Pittsburgh area that embrace neurodiversity, please share that information. I definitely don't have all the answers, but I am a tenacious researcher and advocate when I'm given a worthwhile subject.

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurodiversity

I'm mostly interested in getting together with other liked minded people for fun and recreation. So, I'm not planning on setting any speed or distance records.

results.description:
CURIOUS ABOUT CUBA? 

Our members and affiliates work together to create an opportunity for the people of our region, both individuals and organizations, to engage in mutually beneficial exchanges with the people of Cuba. Despite decades of travel restrictions, hardships and the illegal, crippling, economic blockade, we have continued our work to engage in peaceful and constructive activities with our counterparts in Cuba. 

President Obama's easing of travel restrictions and restarting diplomatic channels to Cuba create new opening for diverse opportunities and exchanges that allow us to expand our relationships and understandings of realities in both of our societies. 

If you are curious about Cuba, please join us, we help people go to Cuba, and hope you will help us bring Cubans to Pittsburgh to share their experiences in building a different more socially compassionate and environmentally sustainable model for human society. Cuba is the only county in the world that has a zero environmental footprint. Healthcare, education, social equality are fundamental human rights in Cuba. We have much to learn from the 'forbidden island.' 

Join us to learn more about Cuba, and meet the Cuban people as we partner to build a better world for all humanity. We are the 'Pittsburgh-Matanzas Sister Cities Partnership' and have been working proudly for over 20 years in our shared goals to support of the Cuban people's determination to create a better world.
results.name: Pittsburgh CUBA Meetup

results.description:
Hi group! I'm Bill. I moved here from Columbus OH, and I'm struck by the lack of mainstream activities in the S Hills area, and activities for (US) older singles. Introducing the new (and unimproved) Mr. Bill's Friday Night South Hills Over-Fifty Meetup.

Events won't always necessarily be on Friday nights; we might do an outdoors, hiking, or park event on a Saturday afternoon. and you don't have to be over fifty to join, there's no restriction on age (or anything else, for that matter.)

Two of the mainstay activities will be current films at an area multiplex, and nice, middle price range restaurants, including Chinese. I have the necessary skill set for both activities. I also want to set up a billiards (and beer!) event, which could become a once-a-month staple event if there's enough interest.

I'll accept all the help I can get putting this together (I have no idea what I'm doing.) But we're going to make this something great. I'm working on a group discount at a multiplex theater, if anyone can help with this, or wants to be an assistant organizer, my email is zaphod.six@gmail.com.

This will be your group; someone just had to take the initiative to get it started. I'll always listen to suggestions, esp. restaurants and other possible activities for the group. And I will be there for all events, that's a given. There will be no fees or dues. The one thing I'm going to be hard-nosed about: when you sign up for a specific event, please be there. Especially for restaurant events, where we have to reserve seating in advance.

One other thing. I've been to a few meetups where the place was full of cigarette smoke. That won't happen!! Also: no "happy hours", per se.  I'm up to here with happy hours; this will be the anti-happy-hour meetup group! Be seeing you!
results.name: Mr. Bill's Friday Night South Hills Singles

results.description:
Girlfriends Pray (GP) Local is everywhere, for every woman, in every season of her life! Once a month our Local Ambassadors host a Saturday morning meet-up in cities all around the world to discuss prayer, and connect with women in their local communities for fellowship, food, and fun on the strength of our faith.
It is the mission of Girlfriends Pray Ministries to get more women closer to God through prayer; and our vision is to get 1 million women around the world united in prayer. Although we are a non-traditional unconventional ministry with 80% of our service to women delivered virtually, in 2015 we expanded our service to women nationally and internationally off-line with our LIVE Breakfast Book Club (BBC) prayer groups.

We encourage you to also partner with us as day after day we connect with women all around the global and come face-to-face with real life issues, challenges and the needs of women. So many women depend on Girlfriends Pray Ministries as a life line to God. Every day we see lives changed, lives impacted and souls led back to Jesus Christ through our local meet-ups and our prayer line, (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#.

Here's a testimony from one of our girlfriends, Courtney -- “For those of you just joining Girlfriends Pray, if it had not been for God and this prayer line on my side …. Where would I be … in the grave by my own hand!”
We thank you in advance for joining us and your financial gift as an offering for the ongoing support of Girlfriends Pray Ministries. To become a partner please CLICK HERE.

We look forward to meeting you face-to-face at our next monthly meet-up.

Blessings,

Girlfriends Pray Local Ambassador Leadership Team
Praying Without Ceasing.... 1 Thessalonians 5:17
Girlfriends Pray Ministries
Prayer Line: (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#

results.description: My name is Steven Harris. I have been teaching preparedness since 1990's. A lot of it in Michigan and Virginia. I'm now here in greater Pittsburgh PA and I have found ZERO REAL Preparedness Groups. Some great ONLINE ones, but I want one like my buddies have in Texas. A group that meets each month. Teaches something each month. Organizes Trips and Classes. Classes on REAL Tactical Weapons (Pistol, Carbine, Shotgun). NOT just an "NRA Level 1A class" but a tactical class that will have you shooting 400-600 rounds per day. When someone in the group is going to butcher rabbits or get in a shipment of Chicks or Ducklings I want them to feel welcome and open enough to invite over those from the group that want to learn. For those who run a big garden, want a bunch of help planting? I want those in the group that want to learn planting to be able to come over and help you plant. I want it to be a community from the community. Come to the 1st Meeting, probably at the Pine Twp Community Center on April 28th 2016 7pm - 9pm. We ONLY have room for 50 people. If you are coming, you MUST sign up for the meeting at http://bit.ly/PittPrepGroup PLEASE share this on facebook and spread the work to your friends. We have a facebook page at http://tinyurl.com/zmkvb2l Some of the things that we will be teaching are: Food Storge that really works, starting easy. Emergency cooking Easy storage of water Bugout bags and get home bags Emergency Battery for My House Generator Power for My Home How to Safely store Gasoline Alternative and Emergency Heating Solar power How to Keep my Refrigerator and Freezer Cold Basic First Aid and Disaster Medicine Cell Phones, Police Scanners, CB Radios and other communications Home Security Systems and Lighting Defensive Tactical Pistol, Carbine and Shotgun Financial Security and Investing for Preppers Gardening - Food Plots Verticle Gardening Permaculture Gardening and Food Forests Animals such as Chicens, Ducks and Quail Animals such as Rabbits, Goats and Cows Preparedness for Car or Truck Hiking and other outdoor activities.
results.name: Wexford Emergency Preparedness Meetup - Pittsburgh Preppers

results.description:
This MeetUp group is for people in the Pittsburgh, PA area who speak and read (or would like to learn) Hindustani*!


Hindustani is an Indo-Aryan language, deriving primarily from the Khariboli dialect of Delhi, and incorporates a large amount of vocabulary from Sanskrit, Persian, Arabic, and Chagatai. It is a pluricentric language, with two official forms: Modern Standard Hindi and Modern Standard Urdu, which are its standardised registers, and which may be called Hindustani or Hindi-Urdu when taken together.


The colloquial languages are mutually intelligible and all but indistinguishable, and even though the official standards are nearly identical in grammar, they differ in literary conventions and in academic and technical vocabulary, with Urdu adopting stronger Persian, Turkic and Arabic influences, and Hindi relying more heavily on Sanskrit. Hindi is written in the Devanāgarī script, and Urdu is written in a modified Persian script (itself a modification of Arabic script).


*I am not a native speaker, but I hope that once a critical mass of interest is achieved, we can enroll native speakers to aid those of us who wish to learn!
results.name: Pittsburgh Hindi/Urdu/Hindustani Language Meetup

results.description:
Read.Write.Love. is more than a Meetup, it's a movement for women of Faith who are climbing to lift others in their communities. We are women of faith who have accepted our callings as passionpreneurs, artists, community organizers, writers, instigators of change, and creatives who need a space to connect, be challenged and to grow forward! 

Sisterfriend, when you choose to surrender and begin to walk the divine path that He has chosen for you, you become unstoppable!  That said, I know from personal experience that the journey, while divinely created specifically for you, can be challenging and gets lonely at times.  Having a supportive group of bold, creative and courageous women is necessary for your sanity and success.  Engaging with like-minded sisterfriends who can encourage you in both your strengths and weaknesses and give feedback is a powerful way to connect with the woman you are at your core.  The environment sets the tone for an environment in which your vision and dream will begin to flourish.

So, lets DO THIS!

We come together twice a month for The Book Club, and for Masterminding (and the occasional Girls Night Out or IN) for fellowship, food & fun as we focus on mapping our missions! Here's what you can look forward to monthly: 

The Book Club: This is NOT your average book club. This book club is a space for Women on a Mission to come together and explore the ideas, strategies and stories of other women that will empower us to grow forward in a major way in our businesses and careers. Each month we will select a book and delve into how it applies to our journeys. Bring your journals and an open mind as we share inspiration and observations to impact both our own lives and each others.

Masterminding: Are you planning to launch your blog? Organizing a new community initiative? Preparing to open a business or go public with your "hustle"? Join us each month for creative, monthly in person mastermind sessions during which there may be a mini workshop, mission mapping, and ofcourse discussion and time to share Fun foods. Yes,  

Love & Hugs,

Tiff

Read.Write.Love. Community Housekeeping 

Please be considerate of time and effort of The Community Organizer as well as your fellow sisterfriends as you RSVP for meetups, as space is limited for each session.  If you RSVP, and are no longer able to attend, please change your RSVP from "Yes" to "No."  If you realize at the last minute (i.e. day of the event) that you aren't able to attend, please change your RSVP AND message the organizer.

*Downloading the Meetup App for your Smart Phone will make this super easy.
results.name: Read. Write. Love.

results.description:
This group and online resources will help prepare you for a long-term grid power blackout, or almost any mega-disaster. We've developed a viral strategy that can protect Pittsburgh and then the entire country. One theme is to insure yourself and then move on with your life. A small amount of effort and education can go a long way!

You should join if you want access to free disaster preparedness information, and if you'd like to mobilize to protect yourself, loved ones and the country.  Unlike many prepper groups, our emphasis is on a solution that protects the entire country  -- because otherwise the survivors would be living in an emotionally traumatized and economically crippled country.

Instead, we believe that a chain reaction of people doing preparation, supporting others to prepare, and pushing government to prepare for those who can't afford to prepare can rapidly protect the country. 

Most people who learn about the grid problem get emotionally overwhelmed or feel despair, but we've found that meaningful action displaces negative feelings and replaces them with positive feelings, such as higher self-esteem when you learn information and skills that will protect yourself.

A lot of useful information and videos can be found at our main website, GridEmergency.Org
results.name: Grid Emergency (America Mobilizes)

Phenomenal Women of Pittsburgh is a community of women who instigate change locally and globally through professional and personal development. We are a group of feminist-minded professionals who want to change the world by empowering other girls and women. We will collaborate, create, and communicate with each other to encourage personal and professional development for women in Pittsburgh. We will use our personal and professional connections to empower women and girls in the Pittsburgh area. 

What we do: 

Regular MeetUps 

Our typical events will primarily focus on activities that are geared towards women and women’s issues. Let’s get together to attend speaking events, performances, lectures, movies, and any other activities that support women in Pittsburgh, expand our networks, and encourage personal and professional growth! 

Special Events 

These events will include group trips to conferences and other seminars for professional women. 

Book Club Series 

Our Book Club Series will meet quarterly to discuss feminist literature. Feel free to make suggestions for what we should read next!

Discussion Board

Visit our Discussion Board for articles, publications, news stories, events, book group discussion questions, and other interesting tidbits pulled from the interwebs. Let's learn something new together!
